In ancient days silver\nwas the official antibiotic and antiseptic.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Swara Shastras\nit is written that if the breath can be analysed and its significance\nunderstood, deeper knowledge of the cosmos will unfold and the knowledge of the\nVedas can be realised. The individual consciousness can perceive cosmic\nconsciousness by means of swara. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nbreath, carrying both prana (vital energy) and chitta (consciousness) vibrates\nfrom the force of these energies and sound is thereby produced.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All the ancient Vedic\ntexts refer to the subtle and vital life giving force called prana, which is\ndescribed as being similar in nature to lightning. Solely due to prana, the\nwhole universe exists and without its presence no creature can live.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although\nprana exists in the air and in all forms of matter, it is neither of the two.\nNor is prana the breath, but it is contained within the breath, being a part of\nthe swara.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prana maintains all\norganic life. Just as a battery stores electrical energy, so it is essential\nfor every organism to store prana in order to enable activity and mobility. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Maharishis with high prana levels and high soul\nvibrations keep their hand on someones head to transfer prana.&nbsp; Prana can be transferred by a chakra to\nchakra hug.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By practising swara\nyoga, the store of prana can be increased, thereby activating the latent areas\nof the brain. Swara yoga directly controls the input and output of prana,\nenabling us to regulate our whole physiological system. ..</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Discovery of Kirlian\nphotography has enabled scientists to actually see the corona of these fields.&nbsp; Maharishis who could see auras &nbsp;were well aware of the principles of energy\nfields without requiring the aid of modern technology.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Swarodaya Yoga Shiva\ntells Parvati about opposing currents and breath.&nbsp; Swara yogis know the positive and&nbsp; negative energy currents flowing in the body<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By practising swara\nyoga, the store of prana can be increased, thereby activating the latent areas\nof the brain.&nbsp; Swara yoga directly\ncontrols the input and output of prana, enabling us to regulate our whole\nphysiological system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sympathetic and\nParasympathetic Nervous systems are what is referred to in Yoga parlance as the\nIda and Pingala Nadis.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sympathetic Nervous\nSystem primes the body for action known as the Fight and Flight response. This\nkeeps the energy and blood circulating to the skeletal muscles. The\nParasympathetic Nervous System is for rest-and-digest\" or \"feed and\nbreed. This keeps the energy and blood concentrated near the organs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sympathetic ( Tamas )\nand Parasympathetic divisions ( Rajas ) typically function in opposition to\neach other.&nbsp; But this opposition is\nbetter termed complementary in nature rather than antagonistic.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For an analogy, one may\nthink of the Sympathetic division as the accelerator and the Parasympathetic\ndivision as the brake. The Sympathetic division typically functions in actions\nrequiring quick responses. The Parasympathetic division functions with actions\nthat do not require immediate reaction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sympathetic Nervous\nSystem originates from the left side of the Sushmna.&nbsp; It flows into the left nostril ultimately\ncrossing and powering the right side of the brain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As long as our Sushumna\nis clogged, the energy cannot make it to the Third Eye (Ajna Chakra) and we\nlive in darkness (Body Consciousness).&nbsp;&nbsp;\nThe Third Eye literally turns on just like a light when it receives the\nproper energy from the Sushumna. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swara yoga explains\nthat the two major energy circuits, ida&nbsp;\nand pingala, can be regulated and controlled by means of&nbsp; the breath. If these currents are not flowing\nproperly, it&nbsp; becomes quite evident in\nthe breath<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unconscious breathing\nis controlled by the medulla oblongata in the brain stem, a region known as the\nprimitive brain, while conscious breathing comes from the more evolved areas of\nthe brain in the cerebral cortex.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each of our actions can\nbe classified under these 3 types of swara, viz left for mental actions, right\nfor physical actions and both swaras together in spiritual actions. This means\nif the right nostril flows while we are meditating, then we will have physical\nobstacles, like unstableness or restlessness of body.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Similarly if the left\nnostril is flowing while meditation, then though physically we are undisturbed,\nbut the mind will wander here and there. It is only that when both the nostrils\nare open, that our mind becomes one pointed and focused.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The right and left\nswara function like positive and negative currents in our body. It is only that\nwhen both the currents are on, our spiritual powers are on. This brings a body\nin disease to a free state. These positive and negative currents are compared\nto the positive and negative ions of the human body.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And it is a proven fact\nabout how these ions affect our whole body mechanisms. And therefore Swara yoga\nclaims that with the manipulation of the breath flowing in and out through our\nnose we can regulate the inner body mechanisms and develop control over all\npranic and mental activities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In modern physics all\nmatter including the air we breathe consists of ions, microscopic\nelectrically charged particles which are either positive or negative. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The intense activity of\nthese positive or negative ions on the area immediately surrounding them is\nreferred to as the ionic field. Ionic concentrations affect the consciousness\nin many ways. In order to demonstrate this, let us apply the ionic field theory\nto pranayama.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With each breath,\nsensory receptors in the respiratory system send signals via the vague nerve to\nthe brainstem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Breathing brings oxygen\nin the blood but also charges the entire body and renews our reserves of vital\nenergies and help to equalize disturbed energy patterns.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The oxygen that we\nbreathe comes in two forms: stable and unstable oxygen molecules. Unstable\noxygen molecule (with temporary unstable electron balance), science named \u2018air\nions\u2019 . Air ions are coming in forms of positive and negative ions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a student\ncommences pranayama, the first one he usually learns is nadi shodhana which\nmeans purification of the nadis. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The method of practice\nis as follows. First breathe in through the left nostril, keeping the right\nclosed. Hold the breath, then closing the left nostril breathe out through the\nright and hold the breath. Breathe in through the right; hold the breath;\nbreathe out through the left; hold the breath. The mouth should be closed\nthroughout. This constitutes one round. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The relative durations\nof inhalation, retention, exhalation, retention are altered at different stages\naccording to ability or need of the student. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let us now look at the\ndifferent stages of nadi shodhana and consider their effect on the ionic field.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Inhalation through the\nLeft Nostril---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The negative ion\nconcentration in ida nadi quickly increases from its rest or basal\nconcentration during left nostril inhalation. It then reaches a maximum and\nbegins to fall off gradually, because the concentration of ions is greater in\nthe regions of low pranic density and less in regions of high pranic density.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, there is a high ionic concentration in the region of prana, udana,\nsamana and a low concentration in apana and vyana. The ionic concentration is\nthus not homogeneous yet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Internal Retention of\nBreath---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the breath is\nheld, two main processes occur:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. The ionic\nconcentration in ida which has just been increased becomes homogeneous, i.e.\nthe concentration of ions becomes equal in all parts of the ida nadi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. At the ionoplasmic\ncentres (chakras) where ida and pingala are in the closest proximity, one being\nin front of sushumna and the other behind, there is an effect called ionic\nmigration and annihilation. When the negative ions from ida migrate towards\npingala, attracted by its positive ions, many are annihilated as they merge.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This has the effect of:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst\" style=\"line-height: 150%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; text-indent: -.25in;\">\n<!--[if !supportLists]--><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">a<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;; font-size: 7pt; font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal;\">&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; ---&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></span><!--[endif]--><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">depleting the number of ions in both ida\nand pingala, but more so in pingala, because of the high concentration of\nnegative ions in ida.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoListParagraphCxSpLast\" style=\"line-height: 150%; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; text-indent: -.25in;\">\n<!--[if !supportLists]--><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">b<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;; font-size: 7pt; font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal;\">&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span><!--[endif]--><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">---- causing energy to be\nliberated in various forms such as heat, light and pranic energy, which has\neither got to be absorbed, transformed or removed in part.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Exhalation through the\nRight Nostril--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During exhalation\nthrough the right nostril it is principally the heat component of the energy\nproduced by the above ionic annihilation process which is liberated. Pingala\nnadi has a very small concentration of positive ions and is thus prepared to\nreceive the influx of positive ions in the next part of the round. Inhalation\nthrough the right nostril.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Inhalation through the\nright nostril increases the positive ion concentration in pingala. It rises\nquickly to a maximum level and then decreases slowly in the same way described\nfor ida nadi. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now we have the\nfollowing situation:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. The negative ion\nconcentration in ida nadi has been increased, homogenized, then decreased slightly\ndue to ion migration and annihilation. This new concentration is still above\nthe basal level but by very little.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. The positive ion\nconcentration pingala has been increased but has not yet been homogenized by\nthe process of retention which follows shortly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. Now a greater ion\nmigration and annihilation effect is taking place as the positive iompn pingala\nhave more mobility and energy. This has the effect of causing a further ionic\ndepletion in ida and also, of course, in pingala; it is a kind of ionic\nsee-saw.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">External Retention of\nBreath---<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With retention, the\nionic concentrations are homogenized and the ionic migration and annihilation\neffect continues.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Normal Breathing--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In normal breathing\nthere is an alteration in the flow of breath in the nostrils. If you check\nwhich nostril is more free to breathe through at different times you will\nobserve that sometimes it is the right, sometimes the left, and occasionally\nboth flow equally. The science of these alternating flows is called swara,\nyoga.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In swara yoga it states that in the average\nhealthy individual, one nostril remains predominantly open for approximately\none hour and 30 minutes; both nostrils then flow equally for ten minutes,\nafter which the other nostril remains predominantly open for one hour and 30\nminutes, then again both flow equally, and so on throughout the day. This is\nreadily observable and can be verified at any time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are two ionic\nmigration effects taking place:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. The negative ion\nmigration from ida to pingala whenever the concentration of negative ions in\nida is increased due to left nostril breathing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. The positive ion\nmigration from pingala to ida whenever there is an increase in its ionic\nconcentration due to right nostril breathing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These effects take\nplace virtually simultaneously during normal breathing since, even when one\nnostril flow is predominant, there is still a flow through the other. After some time, the rate of absorption of the positive ions\nfrom pingala by ida will equal the rate of absorption of negative ions by\npingala, i.e. an equilibrium will occur. This is an unstable equilibrium,\nhowever, and is present only for a very short time.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In nadi shodhana, we\nare in effect mirroring the behaviour of the cyclic changes occurring during\nnormal breathing, by purposely breathing in through the left nostril, holding,\nand breathing out through the right and so on. The difference is that in normal\nbreathing, both nostrils remain equally open or free for a time, whereas in\nnadi shodhana the breath is held.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus, there is a\nconnection between breath retention and having both nostrils open. In swara\nyoga it states that when ida and pingala nadis are both flowing equally, then sushumna,\nthe nadi responsible for the development of higher yogic abilities, starts\nfunctioning.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During retention of\nbreath, sushumna nadi is brought into operation. This is the nadi which is\nactive when the point of unstable equilibrium discussed earlier occurs. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Breath retention thus\nawakens sushumna nadi. In all of the classical works on yoga it is stated that\nfor full spiritual benefits from yoga sadhana, try to ensure that the sushumna\nnadi is flowing when practicing meditation or higher techniques.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The right and left\nswara function like positive and negative currents in our body. It is only that\nwhen both the currents are on, our spiritual powers are on. This brings a body\nin disease to a free state. These positive and negative currents are compared\nto the positive and negative ions of the human body. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These ions affect our\nwhole body mechanisms. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Swara yoga says that with the manipulation of\nthe breath flowing in and out through our nose we can regulate the inner body\nmechanisms and develop control over all pranic and mental activities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Any disturbance in\nbreathing affects the entire circulatory system, all visceral, reproductory and\nexcretory system. Eg. The obstruction in the air flow inside increases the\nheart rate and decreases tissue oxidation. Further, disturbing in the alkaline\nbase levels of the blood. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a surprising fact\nthat the proportion of autonomic nerve fibres in the nasal cavity is more than\n21than the other parts of the central nervous system. Breathing &nbsp;affects our emotions and the release of\ndifferent neurotransmitters. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ida, the negative\nchannel brings consciousness into every part of the body. Its energies are\ncompared with that of the moon and hence also known as lunar nadi. Ida is\nassociated with the parasympathetic nervous system which is responsible for the\nstimulation of visceral organs. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thereby creating\nrelaxation of the superficial muscles and thereby lowering the body\ntemperature. It is for these reasons that it is said to be cooling, relaxing\nand introverting. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pingala is a\ntransmitter of prana shakti. Its energies are compared to that of the sun and\nhence also known as solar nadi. It activates the physical body and externalizes\nthe awareness. It is associated with the sympathetic nervous system, which\nreleases the adrenaline to stimulate the superficial muscles.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This system\nprepares the body to fight against stress and external activities. It is for\nthis reason that it is said to be energizing, heating and extroverting. The\ncerebrum consists of the right and left hemispheres. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The right hemisphere is\ngoverned by the left side of the body and the left hemisphere governs the right\nside of the body. Ida is connected to the right hemisphere and pingla to the\nleft. The right hemisphere is thus responsible for psychic and extrasensory\nperception, and stimulates creative, artistic and musical abilities, while the\nleft hemisphere is responsible for sequentially, linearly and logical\nabilities. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this way the\nhemispheres in association with the nadis, control and motivate our responses\nin day to day life.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When we speak of prana,\nwe do not mean the breath, air or oxygen. Precisely and scientifically\nspeaking, prana means the original life force.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">Below: Kumbhaka Pranayama</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/wV5MV3fsKUo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/wV5MV3fsKUo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The process of\nrespiration has three components.&nbsp;\nPooraka is inspiration of air, kumbhaka means retention, and rechaka is\nexpiration.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kumbhaka is the pause\nbetween an inhale and exhale.. the retention or holding the breath, a state\nwhere there is no inhalation or exhalation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The kumbhaka which\nfollows the exhale is called the bahya kumbhaka and that which follows the\ninhale is called the antara kumbhaka. &nbsp;Bahya\nmeans outer/exterior. &nbsp;Antara means\ninner/interior.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Antar Kumbhaka is\nceasing of breath when the inhalation (or Poorak) is complete and the lungs are\nfilled up with air. In this kumbhaka, inhalation is recommended to be slightly\nforceful to take more air than normal and ceasing it as per one's ability.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bahya Kumbhaka &nbsp;is ceasing of breath when the exhalation (or\nRechak) is complete. It is also recommended to exhale more than normal and then\ncease it as per one's ability. Bahir kumbhaka is not used very often.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kevala kumbhaka implies\nholding the breath with no particular state of respiration in consideration. Kevala\nkumbhaka is one of the final stages of yoga parallel with the state of samadhi</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Practicing kumbhaka for\na long time increases endurance of physiological as well as psychological\nstructure of an individual. That retention of the breath after deep inhalation\nis a pranayama by itself.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ordinary breathing is a\nmechanical function performed by &nbsp;the\nphysical body, but in swara yoga breathing is a process &nbsp;which can be manipulated and controlled. .\nEvery hour or every &nbsp;hour and 30 minutes\nthe active nostril changes. This &nbsp;rhythm\nregulates all the psychological and physiological &nbsp;processes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the swara is irregular, it is a\nclear indication &nbsp;that something is not\nfunctioning properly in the body. .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One swara flows through the left nostril, &nbsp;another flows through the right, and the third\nflows through &nbsp;both nostrils together.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The different swaras influence us in &nbsp;various\nways by stimulating different energy centres and &nbsp;aspects of the nervous system. The rhythm of\nthe body is based on the &nbsp;biorhythms, the\nenergy rhythms of the body, and it also &nbsp;relates\nto the two hemispheres of the brain. &nbsp;.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mind, life force and spirit combined constitute the &nbsp;human being. In swara yoga, mind is known as\nchitta, life &nbsp;force as prana and spirit\nas atma. Chitta controls the sensory &nbsp;nerves:\nthe eyes, nose, tongue, ears and skin. Prana controls &nbsp;the five organs of action: speech, hands,\nfeet, reproductive &nbsp;and urinary/excretory\norgans. Atma is the overall witness or &nbsp;controller.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The left swara presides\nover &nbsp;mental actions, the right swara\nover physical actions, and &nbsp;both swaras\ntogether preside over spiritual actions When the left nostril flows, it\nindicates that the mental &nbsp;energy,\nchitta, is predominant, and the pranic energy is &nbsp;weak. When the right nostril flows, the pranic\nforces are &nbsp;stronger and the mental\naspect is weak.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When both nostrils &nbsp;operate\ntogether, it indicates that the spiritual energy, the &nbsp;force of the atma, is in power. Swara yoga\nenables us to understand the nature of the &nbsp;breath and its influence on the body because\nthe different &nbsp;swaras lead to different\ntypes of action, mental, physical and &nbsp;spiritual.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you are meditating, praying or contemplating &nbsp;the truth, it is spiritual action. When you\nare walking, talking, &nbsp;urinating or\neating, it is physical action. When digestion is &nbsp;going on and the enzymes are flowing in the\nbody, it is &nbsp;physical action.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But when\nyou are worried or have many &nbsp;thoughts on\nyour mind, or when you are planning something, it is mental action. If the right\nnostril flows when you are meditating, &nbsp;you\nwill have physical difficulties. The body will be restless. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the left nostril is\nflowing, you may not be physically disturbed, but the mind will wander.\nHowever, when both nostrils are open, the mind becomes one-pointed. Then you &nbsp;can easily become absorbed in the process of\nmeditation. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swara yoga aims at harmonizing\nthe mind and body by adjusting the actions with the swara. The energy flows\ncreated by the left and right swaras act something like the positive and\nnegative currents in an electrical circuit.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The left swara is the negative\nline, while he right is the positive.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the right nostril is flowing, pingala stimulates the body. When the left nostril is flowing, ida\nstimulates the mental faculties. During the time when the swara is alternating,\nboth nostrils become active simultaneously. Then sushumna nadi &nbsp;stimulates the atma or spiritual potential.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But this usually occurs only during the period of changeover for a couple of minutes.\nSushumna nadi is the cause of spiritual actions and it is the purpose of every\nyogic and tantric system to activate it.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sushumna runs straight up the centre\nof the spine and merges with ida and pingala a little above the nasal root at ajna\nchakra, the point behind the eyebrow centre. . When both nostrils are active,\nit is an indication that the sushumna passage is open. Therefore, equalizing\nthe breath is important for it is associated with the opening of sushumna nadi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When sushumna flows,\nthe mental and physical energy patterns become even and rhythmic, the thoughts\nare stilled and the mind is calm. Therefore, it is also known as the shoonya\nswara. Shoonya means void. For the yogi this is the most significant type of\nswara because it aids in the practice of dhyana or meditation. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The aim of swara yoga\nis therefore to develop the shoonya swara by reducing the activities of the\nalternating breath.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the Shiva\nSwarodaya: \"One has to know about prana and its variations, the nadis or\nenergy pathways, and the different tattwas or elements of the macrocosmos.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through\nthe application of such knowledge, the swara yogi can know all the events of\nthe universe which are both auspicious and inauspicious. He will come to\nrealize that the shakti of the swara, inherent prana, is functioning throughout\nthe whole of creation, and that ultimately even the form of Lord Shiva is the\nswara, the breath and the prana.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prana, has two aspects - cosmic and\nindividual. Cosmic prana is very subtle and can only be perceived by the\ninfinite mind, but individual prana related to the body is grosser and more tangible.\nIn the order of creation, prana emanates from the unmanifest reality known as\nhiranyagarbha, the golden womb or egg.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;On the physical level it manifests as\nindividual existence. Swara yoga develops awareness of the manifestation and\nexistence of prana within our own being so that we can come to realize its\ncosmic propensity. In Shiva Swarodaya, the breath is referred to as the vehicle\nof Brahman or cosmic consciousness <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to swara yoga\nthe body is a storehouse of vital energy, a dynamo with infinite electrical\ncurrents flowing throughout. The ordinary man sees this body as a combination\nof flesh, blood and bone.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But the yogis and scientists have perceived a greater\nforce behind the physical elements, and that is the force of energy or prana\nthe yogis found, that there is an energy link between the physical and psychic\nbodies.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The positive or negative charge of ions in the body has also been seen\nto influence specific physical and mental functions .&nbsp; Therefore, if you can control these energies,\nyou can control the body and mind.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A predominance of negative ions has been\nobserved to have a stimulating and vitalizing effect on the body, whereas a\npredominance of positive ions depresses the system when people are exposed to an\nexcess of positive ions, they become lethargic and if there is constant\nstimulus, then irritation, headaches and respiratory defects can &nbsp;develop. &nbsp;When negative ions are again increased, the\nwhole system is revitalized and reactivated</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tulsi liberates ozone and energises\nthe atmosphere with negative ions. &nbsp;&nbsp;Vrindavan\nof Krishna has king sized Krishna tulsi plants ( dark leaves )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\">Below: Negative ion generator of my home in Calicut</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOG_video_class\" contentid=\"1bc08752b7f94835\" height=\"266\" id=\"BLOG_video-1bc08752b7f94835\" width=\"320\"></object></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 250%;\"><b>IONIC CHARGES ARE THE TRINITY ( BRAHMA /\nVISHNU/ SHIVA ) OF SANATANA DHARMA..<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Electrosmog is the\nundetectable electromagnetic radiation that results from the utilization of\nboth wireless gadgets and mains power.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most widely\nrecognized sources of wireless electrosmog are: Cordless telephones, Infant\ncordless alarms, Phone towers and transmitters. Electrosmog, or E-smog, depicts\nthe artificially made electrical, magnetic, and electromagnetic fields all in\nall.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These fields cause many\nenvironmental pressures that we regularly can\u2019t promptly and specifically\nrecognize. It influences us to a far more prominent degree than was\ncomprehensible a couple of years ago.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The types of\nelectrosmog<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Electrical alternating\nfields (low-frequency)&nbsp; which&nbsp; are caused by electrical voltage and by mains\ncables in lines and gadgets when there is no current streaming, for example sockets.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Magnetic alternating\nfields (low-frequency) happen in things which consume switched \u2013on electricity,\nfor example, cables, transformers, and power supply packs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Electromagnetic\nradiation (high-frequency) are the cause of highly emf emitting devices like\ncell phones, TV , radio and microwave oven. It is very harmful for human beings<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The types of\nelectrosmog---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Electrical alternating\nfields (low-frequency)&nbsp; which&nbsp; are caused by electrical voltage and by mains\ncables in lines and gadgets when there is no current streaming, for example sockets.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Magnetic alternating\nfields (low-frequency) happen in things which consume switched \u2013on electricity,\nfor example, cables, transformers, and power supply packs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Electromagnetic\nradiation (high-frequency) are the cause of highly emf emitting devices like\ncell phones, TV , radio and microwave oven. It is very harmful for human beings<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Sweden more than 4%\nof the population are registered as an ES and they can easily claim benefits\nfrom their government<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Negative ions increase\nour ability to absorb and use oxygen, they increase the uptake of oxygen to\ncells and tissues every now and then giving us the same joyful feeling that we\nget from a couple whiffs of straight oxygen.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Negative ions in high\nconcentrations can also clear the air of mold spores, pollen, dust and other\nhazardous airborne particles. They attach to the positively charged particles\nin large numbers and cause the germs, mold, pollen and other allergens&nbsp; become too heavy to stay airborne.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Therefore, they drop to\nthe floor, which causes the removal of these particles from the air you breathe\nand prevents them from causing respiratory issues and other health issues.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Negative particles repulse each other, so as more are created they are radiated\nfarther and farther into the room they are in. Negative particles neutralize\nthe effect of positive ions..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Negative ions enhances\nthe capacity of the cilia in your respiratory tract that shield your lungs from\naggravation and irritation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Negative ions fortify\nthe body\u2019s safeguard immune system. we say 'breath of fresh air', what we\nreally mean is breath of &nbsp;negative ions.\nFresh air in the city may contain an abundance &nbsp;of positive ions, so even a breath of fresh\nair there won't &nbsp;make you feel refreshed.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern technology is recklessly &nbsp;destroying\nthe natural balance of ions in the atmosphere, &nbsp;especially in more populated areas. Deficiency\nof negative &nbsp;ions is a major contributing\nfactor to the rise of physical and &nbsp;mental\ndepression people are suffering today.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A hormone which is\naffected by negative ions and which has a profound effect on sleep is\nmelatonin. Melatonin is synthesized from serotonin. It is produced by the\npineal gland located in the brain.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Melatonin helps regulate our circadian cycle\nby chemically causing drowsiness which helps in getting us to sleep. Negative\nions&nbsp; help people sleep better .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With\nquality sleep, cells are repaired, the immune system is strengthened and mental\nfunctions are sharpened. Quality sleep can also help reduce the occurrence of\ncommon pains such as backache, and increase your resistance to illness.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Negative ions play a\nrole in causing blood flow to increase through dilation of the capillaries,\nthus causing greater oxygenation to occur. The oxygen level in hemoglobin is\nincreased, helping to maintain good health and well being. This promotes cell\nrespiration, helping us heal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swara Yoga creates\nstatic electricity in the body which helps to recharge the positive ions\nbreathed in from the environment and convert them into negative ions.&nbsp;&nbsp; The effect is the same as that created by\nrain and thunderstorm<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Negative ions have been\ndubbed \u201cthe happy element\u201d because they help to increase the oxygen-carrying\ncapacity of the blood \u2014 especially to the brain. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Negative ions also\nspeed up the oxidation of serotonin (5-hydroxtryptamine), which has positive\neffects on mood, pain relief and sexual drive. They also counteract free\nradicals \u2014 known as positive ions \u2014 which are created through exposure to\nenvironmental toxins \u2014 like chemicals, electronic equipment, cellphones and\nradiation. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; HE WORKS IN SAUDI ARABIA SWEATING BLOOD FOR 3 DECADES..<br />\n<br />\nHE SAVES A SMALL AMOUNT FOR HIS FUTURE LIFE ( NO EARNINGS ) IN A BANK... SO THAT HE CAN LIVE OFF THE INTEREST. THIS ENTIRE MONEY HAS BEEN EARNED ABROAD , SENT TO THE BANK FROM ABROAD --AND THE GOVT HAVE NO RIGHT TO TAX IT.<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">BUT THE INTEREST HE GETS ON THIS SAVED AMOUNT IS TAXED BY THE GOVT , NOW THAT HE IS NOT AN NRI ANYMORE.. DUE TO INFLATION, THE REAL VALUE OF THIS BANK SAVINGS DIMINISHES EVERY YEAR ..</span></b><br />\n<br />\nTHIS POOR MAN DEPENDS ON THIS MEAGRE MONTHLY INTEREST TO SURVIVE AND EDUCATE HIS CHILDREN-- WHO DONT GET JOBS KERALA ( DUE TO THE SCOURGE OF COMMUNISM )<br />\n<br />\nNOW LET US CHECK OUT A PRIVATE EMPLOYEE IN AN IT COMPANY WHO GETS POOR WAGES ..HE PAYS HIS INCOME TAX EVERY MONTH. HE SAVES LIKE A BEE EVERY MONTH BIT BY BIT -- SO THAT HE CAN SURVIVE AFTER HE RETIRES ..<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">WHY SHOULD THE GOVT TAX HIM ON THE INTEREST HE EARNS FROM WHAT HE HAS SAVED IN THE BANK BY LIVING FRUGALLY ALL HIS EARNING LIFE -- THE PRINCIPAL AMOUNT HAS ALREADY BEEN TAXED ONCE AT SOURCE ..</span></b><br />\n<br />\nWE WANT THE MODI GOVT TO ADDRESS THIS GRAVE INJUSTICE..<br />\n<br />\nWHY DOES A BLOGGER NEED TO ASK THIS QUESTION ? ..<br />\n<br />\nARE THERE NO INTELLIGENT PEOPLE IN INDIA? ..<br />\n<br />\nWHAT ARE OUR THINK TANKS WORTH? ..
