text-decoration-line: none;\">February 6, 2018 at 8:54 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_34MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nGurur Brahmaa Gurur Vishnu<br />\nGurur Devo Maheshwarah<br />\nGuru Saakshaata Parabrahma<br />\nTasmai Shri Guruve Namah<br />\n<br />\nGuru is Brahma, Guru is Vishnu,<br />\nGuru is Maheshwara (Shiva),<br />\nGuru is Supreme Brahman Itself<br />\nProstration unto that Guru<br />\n<br />\nABOVE IS A COOKED UP VERSE BY THE WHITE INVADER<br />\n<br />\nAND WE TREAT ANAL SEX RECEIVING HOMOSEXUALS WITH LONG BEARD /HAIR IN SAFFRON ROBES AS GOD?<br />\n<br />\nHOW CAN A MORTAL MAN BE \"BRAHMAN \"?<br />\n<br />\nTHE USED THIS VERSE TO MAKE A UNWASHED MUSLIM VAGABOND SHIRDI SAI BABA -- A HINDU GOD<br />\n<br />\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DqruHSgGcMs<br />\n<br />\nALL HINDU GODS ARE COSMIC ALLEGORIES --EXCEPT VISHNU MORTAL AVATARS RAMA/ KRISHNA/ AYYAPPA<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SOMEBODY ASKED MY\u2014WHAT THIS\nSUPERSTITION OF THREE AND A HALF COILS?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WELL IT IS MATH \u2013 22/7 =\n3.14<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIS IS WHY I HAVE NOT\nTOUCHED THE HEAD OF THE SNAKE ON THE VERTICAL AXIS OF SUSHUMNA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ALL SUPERSTITIONS\nBESTOWED ON SANATANA DHARMA ARE PURE DIVINE MATH OR QUANTUM PHYSICS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sankhya system is\nbased on Sat-k\u0101rya-v\u0101da or the theory of causation. According to Satk\u0101ryav\u0101da,\nthe effect is pre-existent in the cause. The Sankhya system is an evolutionary\ntheory of matter beginning with primordial matter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In evolution, Prakriti\n( Shakti ) &nbsp;is transformed and\ndifferentiated into multiplicity of objects. Evolution is followed by\ndissolution. In dissolution the physical existence, all the worldly objects\nmingle back into Prakriti, which now remains as the undifferentiated,\nprimordial substance.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Sankhya, direct\nperception is the most important and fundamental source of all knowledge. When\nsenses cannot directly perceive due to their limitations, inference is needed\nsuch as in philosophical disputations.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The very existence of Purusa ( BrahmAn \u2013\nmorphogenetic consciousness ) is possible only through inference. &nbsp;&nbsp;Prakriti cannot be perceived, not because of\nits non-existence, but because of its subtlety. It is perceived in its effects.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Purusha, or supreme\nconsciousness ( BrahmAn ) , is the impassive observer of all phenomena.\nPrakriti,&nbsp; excited&nbsp; in response to Purusa\u2019s attention , has her\ngunas ( Yin-Yang or Tamas \u2013Rajas ) thrown out of equilibrium.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She moves from\ntranscendence to immanence and undergoes a series of transformations through\nwhich the multiform world comes into being.&nbsp;\nPurusha, was never really in bondage, or enmeshed with Prakriti.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sankhya philosophy\nunified the Advaita and Dvaita forms of Hinduism in a most interesting\nmanner.&nbsp;&nbsp; Here when the insentient\nPrakriti ( female \u2013Dvaita ) comes in contact with the sentient Purusha (male\n\u2013Advaita ) , the universe evolves.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Check out the allegory-\nPurusha is bewitched nay entranced by Prakriti .&nbsp; Prakriti is only too eager to oblige by\ndisplaying her subtle charms.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a dancer,&nbsp; after having performed for the observer ,\nstops dancing, so does Prak\u1e5bti cease to perform for an individual Puru\u1e63ha when\nher task is accomplished.&nbsp; Female\nPrakirti&nbsp; has danced for male Puru\u1e63ha,\nand as he is no longer interested in her (\u201cI have seen her\u201d), she stops forever\n(\u201cI have already been seen\u201d).&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sankhya thus is a\ntheory of evolution and understanding the universe.&nbsp; The dancing girl dances as long as the male\nobserver is there. The moment the observer ceases to look at her and\nunderstands the dance perfectly, she fails to amuse him anymore.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Purusha, or supreme\nconsciousness ( BrahmAn ) , is the impassive observer of all phenomena.\nPrakriti,&nbsp; excited&nbsp; in response to Purusa\u2019s attention , has her\ngunas ( Yin-Yang or Tamas \u2013Rajas ) thrown out of equilibrium.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She moves from\ntranscendence to immanence and undergoes a series of transformations through\nwhich the multiform world comes into being.&nbsp;\nPurusha, was never really in bondage, or enmeshed with Prakriti.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prakriti cannot be\nperceived, not because of its non-existence, but because of its subtlety. It is\nperceived in its effects.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE SHALLOW MINDED\nWHITE MAN CONVERTED ALL THIS TO BASE SEX BETWEEN TWO MORTALS..&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tantric system borrows\nthe abstract dualism of Sankhya and modifies it into a personified male\u2013female\ndualism.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SEVEN DEPICTS THE\nCHAKRAS <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">22 REPRESENTS TATTVAS\nLEADING TO DISSOLVING EGO<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The tattvas are\nguideposts to orient ourselves within the map and to see what we experience as\nseparate concepts are truly part of a larger whole. .&nbsp; Tattva is a Sanskrit and Malayalam word\nmeaning&nbsp; 'principle', 'reality' .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">22. Ahamkara \u2013\nobjective ego<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">21. Manas \u2013 mind<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Jnanendriyas Sense-organs, for receiving the\nbhutas and the tanmatras, viz<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">20&nbsp; karna (the auditory sense)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">19&nbsp; tvak (the thermal sense)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">18&nbsp; chaksu (the visual sense)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">17&nbsp; rasana (the gustatory sense)&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">16&nbsp; nasa (the olfactory sense)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karmaendriyas organs of\naction<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">15 vak (vocal\norgan)&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">14 pani (manual\norgan)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">13 pada (organ of locomotion)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">11 upastha (genital\norgan)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Shabda \u2013 sound<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">9. Sparsha \u2013 feel<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">8. Rupa \u2013 form<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7. Rasa \u2013 taste<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6. Gandha \u2013 smell<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mahabhutas \u2013 gross\nelements<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5. Akasha \u2013 space<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. Vayu \u2013 air<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. Tejas \u2013 fire<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. Ap \u2013 water<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. Prithivi \u2013 earth<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u093e\u0919\u094d\u0916\u094d\u092f\u092f\u094b\u0917\u094c</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u0943\u0925\u0917\u094d\u092c\u093e\u0932\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">:\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930\u0935\u0926\u0928\u094d\u0924\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Those who are truly learned say that by\napplying ourselves to any one of these paths, we can achieve the results of\nboth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 3.3: The Blessed\nLord said: O sinless one, the two paths leading to enlightenment were\npreviously explained by me: the path of knowledge, for those inclined toward\ncontemplation, and the path of work for those inclined toward action.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930\u0915\u0943\u0924\u093f\u0938\u094d\u0925\u094b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0915\u093e\u0930\u0923\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0917\u0941\u0923\u0938\u0919\u094d\u0917\u094b\u093d\u0938\u094d\u092f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n|| 22||<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Bhagawad Gita 13.22\n---4000 BC</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">puru\u1e63ha\u1e25 prak\u1e5biti-stho\nhi bhu\u1e45kte prak\u1e5biti-j\u0101n gu\u1e47\u0101n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">k\u0101ra\u1e47a\u1e41 gu\u1e47a-sa\u1e45go \u2019sya\nsad-asad-yoni-janmasu<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 13.22: When the puru\u1e63h\n(individual soul) seated in prak\u1e5biti (the material energy) desires to enjoy the\nthree gu\u1e47as, attachment to them becomes the cause of its birth in superior and\ninferior wombs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Awakening the power of\nKundalini is a journey. &nbsp;The karmic\nbaggage has to be reduced. &nbsp;Ego has to take\na backseat. &nbsp;Soul vibration frequency\nincreases. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once the root chakra,\nhome of Kundalini, opens, the static energy housed there flows freely.. As it\nflows up the spine, Kundalini boosts the remaining five chakras along the way\nbefore igniting the crown, or 7th, chakra.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When energy flows uninterrupted,\nlike a snake winding up the the spine, the chakra circuit is complete. Only\nthen is there potential for transcending the physical plane to reach\nEnlightenment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kundalini refers to &nbsp;primal energy ( shakti) &nbsp;located at the base of the spine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The concept of\nKundalini as \"the figure of a coiled female serpent\u2014a serpent goddess not\nof \"gross\" but \"subtle\" substance\u2014which is to be thought of\nas residing in a torpid, slumbering state in a subtle center, the first of the\nseven, near the base of the spine.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\naim of Tantra and Swara Yoga is to rouse this serpent, lift her head, and bring\nher up a subtle nerve or channel of the spine to the so-called\n\"thousand-petaled lotus\" (Sahasrara) at the crown of the head.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shakti, rising from the\nlowest to the highest lotus center will pass through and wake the five between,\nand with each waking, the psychology and personality of the practitioner will\nbe altogether and fundamentally transformed.. The Kundalini experience is\nfrequently reported to be a feeling of electric current running along the spine.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When this happens the yogi\u2019s aura becomes VIBGYOR encased in a golden sheath.&nbsp; His soul has ascended the frequency of the\nfirst six astral layers and it now of the same frequency of the seventh astral\nlayer\u2014the mother field of Brahman..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sanskrit adjective\nku\u1e47\u1e0dalin means \"circular, annular\". Energy is said to accumulate in\nthe muladhara, and the yogi seeks to send it up to the brain transforming it\ninto 'Ojas', the highest form of energy. Thishas nothing to do with semen as told\nby that duffer Freemason Vivekananda.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u090f\u0937\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0924\u0947\u093d\u092d\u093f\u0939\u093f\u0924\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u093e\u0919\u094d\u0916\u094d\u092f\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BG 2.39: Hitherto, I\nhave explained to you S\u0101nkhya Yog, or analytic knowledge regarding the nature\nof the soul. Now listen, O Parth, as I reveal Buddhi Yog, or the Yog of\nIntellect. When you work with such understanding, you will be freed from the\nbondage of karma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word Sankhya comes\nfrom the roots Sa\u1e45, meaning \u201ccomplete,\u201d and khya, meaning \u201cto know.\u201d So Sankhya\nmeans the \u201ccomplete analytical knowledge of something.\u201d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of your 72,000 energy\nlines, or nadis, three are of particular interest in our exploration of prana\nbreathing. The ida nadi channel flows to the left of your spine, the pingala\nnadi channel to the right, and the central nadi channel, which approximates\nyour spine, is known as the sushumna.</span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just as you need\nphysical oxygen to vitalize your body, you need prana energy to enliven your\nmind and emotions.&nbsp; Prana energy provides\nthe basic stimulus that sets all things in motion. In doing so, it enhances\nyour appreciation of, and zest for, life, and opens your heart and mind to new\npossibilities of every kind\u2014from your personal creativity and productivity at work\nto your relationships with others and your environment..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prana energy nourishes\nyour brain as it supervises the workings of your nervous system. You may not be\naware of it, but you receive and breathe prana energy all the time\u2014from the\nfood you eat, the water you drink, from sunlight and the air you breathe, and\nfrom the people around you. You also give it away to others.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If your body is\nhealthy and full of vitality, you naturally affect those around you in a\npositive way when you transfer your prana energy, consciously or unconsciously.\nPeople enjoy being with you because they feel invigorated by the encounter. But\nwhen you feel distressed or lacking in positive energy, others may find your\npresence emotionally draining.. .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The healing process works by directing prana\nenergy to areas of your body that need help and by breaking up blockages in\nenergy channels to allow prana to flow unimpeded. A good flow of prana\nstimulates cells and tissues and encourages the elimination of toxins, helping\nto restore healthy activity to that part of your body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Well, well, what do they know !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The key to quality REM\nsleep is optimizing the secretion of melatonin, the hormone that influences\nsleep the most. As daylight dims so does our energy as less essential chemicals\nfor activity are produced. This causes our core temperature to fall. It is at\nthis point the body starts to convert serotonin into melatonin. As melatonin\nlevels gradually increase we start to tire as our body prepares for sleep<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The SCN takes the\ninformation from the retina on the light levels, and their duration, and passes\nit to the pineal gland.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pineal gland is\nresponsible for the secretion of melatonin. However artificial lighting\ndisrupts this process which can result in the pineal gland misinterpreting the\ntime of day and confuses our circadian rhythm. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is why spending a\nlot of time under artificial light can have adverse effects on our health. Good\nlighting should therefore follow the patterns and rhythms of natural light.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Evening light in your\nhome must be golden , NOT white like Mumbai Irani restaurants <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the sun shines on\nthe skin, the nerve endings absorb energy and send it throughout the entire\nbody.&nbsp; This calms the nerves. when the\nsun hits your skin it manufactures vitamin D in your body and then works as a\ngreat natural aid to calcium absorption. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You get good REM sleep\nwhen you do Suryanamaskar. Many antidepressants suppress REM sleep.. Many\npeople who suffer from insomnia try to solve the problem with alcohol \u2013 the\nso-called night cap. While alcohol does help people fall into light sleep, it\nalso robs them of REM and the deeper, more restorative stages of sleep.\nInstead, it keeps them in the lighter stages of sleep, from which they can be\nawakened easily.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">REM sleep stimulates\nthe brain regions used in learning. This may be important for normal brain\ndevelopment during infancy, which would explain why infants spend much more\ntime in REM sleep than adults .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">REM\nsleep affects learning of certain mental skills. People taught a skill and then\ndeprived of non-REM sleep could recall what they had learned after sleeping,\nwhile people deprived of REM sleep could not.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People who do NOT get\nproper REM sleep can do PHD in a subject.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\nBut after a year he has forgotten everything he learnt and is unable to\nput what he learnt in practice.&nbsp; You can\nsee that most of your bosses belong to this category and they illtreat you, so\nthat fear can make you fill up his blanks and sustain his job security.&nbsp; Without REM sleep you will lack perception.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">REM sleep helps&nbsp; prevent seizures that begin in one part of\nthe brain from spreading to other brain regions, while deep sleep may promote\nthe spread of these seizures. Sleep deprivation also triggers seizures in people\nwith some types of epilepsy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People with depression\nhave very little REM sleep.&nbsp; They often\nawaken in the early hours of the morning and find themselves unable to get back\nto sleep. The amount of sleep a person gets also strongly influences the symptoms\nof mental disorders. Sleep deprivation is an effective therapy for people with\ncertain types of depression, while it can actually cause depression in other\npeople. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Extreme sleep\ndeprivation can lead to a seemingly psychotic state of paranoia and\nhallucinations in otherwise healthy people, and disrupted sleep can trigger\nepisodes of mania (agitation and hyperactivity) in people with manic\ndepression.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sleeping problems are\ncommon in many other disorders as well, including Alzheimer's disease, stroke,\ncancer, and head injury.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These sleeping problems may arise from changes in the\nbrain regions and neurotransmitters that control sleep, or from the drugs used\nto control symptoms of other disorders. In patients who are hospitalized or who\nreceive round-the-clock care, treatment schedules or hospital routines also may\ndisrupt sleep.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The old joke about a patient being awakened by\na nurse so he could take a sleeping pill contains a grain of truth. Our good\nold Florence Nightingale( suffering from OCD ) &nbsp;was one such.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once REM sleeping\nproblems develop, they can add to a person's impairment and cause confusion,\nfrustration, or depression. Patients who are unable to sleep also notice pain\nmore and may increase their requests for pain medication.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Go to bed at a set time\neach night and get up at the same time each morning. Excess magnesium that is not deposited in\nbone or retained in tissue is excreted through the urine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stress causes your\nadrenal glands to produce more adrenaline and other hormones, like cortisol,\ncausing more magnesium excretion. When your magnesium is low, your adrenal\nglands produce still more cortisol, which in turn decreases your levels of\nDHEA, -- an anti-aging hormone .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alcoholism, renal\ndisease, diabetes mellitus may all cause a magnesium deficiency to occur.\nMagnesium helps blood pressure become and stay regulated, reduces the formation\nof plaque in arteries, and reduces spasms. Magnesium prevents excessive amounts\nof calcium from damaging heart cells.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It also dilates your\narteries, allowing better blood flow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Magnesium is essential\nfor proper insulin levels. You cannot produce insulin, you cannot secrete\ninsulin, and your cells cannot recognize insulin without proper levels of\nMagnesium.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Excess calcium reduces\nmagnesium.&nbsp; Calcium and magnesium work\ntogether in muscle contraction and relaxation.&nbsp;\nIf magnesium isn't available, the mineral ion channels in cells are left\nwide open and calcium floods in leading to it's calcification. Loss of\nmagnesium leads to a relentless increase of sodium and calcium which ultimately\nbecomes the greatest form of cellular \"Stress\u201d.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dominance of calcium\nover magnesium produces symptoms of muscle spasm. Migraines, eyelid twitch,\nheart flutters, back aches, premenstrual tension, leg cramps and constipation\nare all linked to calcium overload.&nbsp;\nExcessive calcium may also result in kidney stones and heart valve\ncalcifications. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Therefore, the ratio of\ncalcium to magnesium has to be 1:1, as compared with a 15:1 ratio in\npresent-day diets.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Magnesium deficiency\ncan lead directly to cancer. While calcium is not used in many enzymes in the\nbody, magnesium is a component of thousands of enzyme. Magnesium is essential\nfor thousands of enzymes in the body and may be said to represent enzyme\nstrength, while calcium represents structural strength or bone strength. . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In electrical terms,\ncalcium represents a compressive pressure or voltage.&nbsp; Magnesium is tensive and more about amperage\nor intensity.&nbsp; Ohm\u2019s law and Joule\u2019s law\napply here.&nbsp; For example, Joule\u2019s law\nstates that voltage multiplied by amps = power or watts. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both Calcium and\nMagnesium are divalent cations, both form hard compounds, and both have a\nmainly calming effect on the body, although magnesium is needed for energy\nproduction, as well. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The calcium magnesium\nratio, reveals the physical, mental, emotional and other aspects of a person\nall at once. With a high ratio, calcium, the cement-like mineral, is more\ndominant.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is associated with a kind\nof defensiveness ( behaving like a PRICK of the first order ).&nbsp; When the ratio is low, the opposite can be\ntrue, and a person often demonstrates less defensiveness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Magnesium and Vitamin D\nshould be taken together in order to avoid vitamin D side effects and to\nmaximize absorption of both nutrients. Nutrients don't work alone, and when it\ncomes to taking vitamin D, it's important that you take magnesium.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many of the 'Vitamin D\nSide Effects' are not problems with the vitamin D, but are problems with not\ngetting enough magnesium!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6200 year old AyurvedIC\nTEXT Charaka Samhita recommended Magnesium rich foods.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/02/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_7.html?showComment=1518012408836#c7699599423217552828\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 7, 2018 at 7:36 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_57MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-02-07/noam-chomsky-talks-donald-trump-nuclear-war-tpp-and-australia/9406072</span><br />\n<br />\nBALLS THIS JEW NOAM CHOMSKY IS AN INTELLECTUAL..<br />\n<br />\nNLP-conmen talk about being able to \u2018reprogram\u2019 their own (and other\u2019s) brain.. NLP has given credence to Jew Noam Chomsky\u2019s mindless \u201cColorless green ideas sleep furiously\u201d linquistics ..<br />\n<br />\nChomsky can fool the whole planet, but NOT Capt Ajit Vadakayil who knows when the emperor walks naked..<br />\n<br />\nChomsky's linguistics are as warped as his double agent politics\u2026<br />\n<br />\nNoam Chomsky invented something called 'universal grammar' which is somehow programmed into us at birth.. In India almost everybody knows at least 3 languages .. It is pretty obvious to us that there is no such thing as 'universal grammar'..<br />\n<br />\nIt is bullshit that we formulate 'deep structures' in our heads using 'universal grammar'\u2014and that too in a stupid language called English..<br />\n<br />\nThe combination of junk science and junk politics has made Chomsky an attractive - and unstoppable - juggernaut in the kosher controlled Western academic world\u2026<br />\n<br />\nLinguists who reject the bullshit Chomskyan paradigm are marginalized , blackballed and shut out of the profession entirely..<br />\n<br />\nChomsky is a Rothschild backed prophet who demands that people believe him. ..Since his claims cannot be proved, they have to be taken on faith\u2026<br />\n<br />\nUniversal grammar (UG) in linguistics, is the theory of the genetic component of the language faculty, credited to Noam Chomsky\u2026<br />\n<br />\nThe basic postulate of UG is that a certain set of structural rules are innate to humans, independent of sensory experience. .With more linguistic stimuli received in the course of psychological development, children then adopt specific syntactic rules that conform to UG.<br />\n<br />\nChomsky argued that the human brain contains a limited set of constraints for organizing language. This implies in turn that all languages have a common structural basis: the set of rules known as \"universal grammar\" ( sic )..<br />\n<br />\nSanskrit is the mother of all language . .<br />\n<br />\nI know Sanskrit\u2014Chomsky does not. .<br />\n<br />\nMy mother tongue Malayalam is the closet language on this planet to Sanskrit-- and I studied Sanskrit in school ..<br />\n<br />\nSanskrit is the oldest language on this planet , while Malayalam ( the language of Danavas ) is second oldest. .<br />\n<br />\nEvery vestige of ancient Indian knowledge is Danava. . I am a Danava..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">In Sanskrit every word (except adverbs and particles) is inflected, and the grammatical inflexion itself shows the relation in which one word stands to another.. Thus grammatically speaking, there is no order as such that need be much attended to ....&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\nCHOMSKY HAS NO RIGHT TO CALL HIMSELF A LINGUISTICS EXPERT WITHOUT BASIC UNDERSTANDING OF SANSKRIT\u2014THE MOTHER OF ALL LANGUAGES . ..<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: magenta;\">SRUTI OF VEDAS IN SANSKRIT IS 400 CENTURIES OLD\u2026</span></b><br />\n<br />\nCHOOT Chomsky spAke\u2014\u201cA grammar contains a syntactic component, a semantic component and a phonological component...The syntactic component consists of a base and a transformational component. The base, in turn, consists of a categorial subcomponent and a lexicon. The base generates deep structures. A deep structure enters the semantic component and receives a semantic interpretation; it is mapped by transformational rules into a surface structure, which is then given a phonetic interpretation by the rules of the phonological component\u201d..<br />\n<br />\nIn above grammar model of CHOOT CHOMSKY , syntax is given a prominent, generative role, whereas phonology and semantics are assigned secondary, interpretive roles..<br />\n<br />\nThe theoretical constructs and principles of the generative grammar introduced by Chomsky such as deep structures, transformations, autonomy and primacy of syntax, etc. deserve to be shat on and thrown on Chomsky\u2019s face. ..<br />\n<br />\nI am sorry, I have been reduced to this\u2026<br />\n<br />\nMindless Chomskyanism has been the dominant paradigm in linguistics for nearly forty years\u2026<br />\n<br />\nSo, so , so-- If you toe CHOOT Chomsky\u2019s line, you are a genius ?..<br />\n<br />\nNot any more !.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_57BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_57b+seedvynD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_54TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_54TN\"></span></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"thread-dropContainer thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_54TD\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_57b+seedvynD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_54TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_54TN\"><span class=\"thread-drop\"></span></span></span></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_57b+seedvynD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_54TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_54TN\">\n</span></span><br />\n</span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_54TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_57b+seedvynD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_54B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2448629017141913090\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_54M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/02/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_7.html?showComment=1518012676570#c2448629017141913090\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 7, 2018 at 7:41 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_54MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nNeuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP) was invented in the mid-70s by Richard Bandler (a psychology and philosophy graduate) and John Grinder (a linguist). It originally grew out of observations made in therapy, and a metaphorical extension of some of the concepts of Chomsky\u2019s transformational grammar..<br />\n<br />\nNoam Chomsky developed the BULLSHIT idea that each sentence in a language has two levels of representation \u2014 a deep structure and a surface structure. The deep structure represents the core semantic relations of a sentence, and is mapped onto the surface structure (which follows the phonological form of the sentence very closely) via transformations. .<br />\n<br />\nAll this in a BULLSHIT language called English\u2026<br />\n<br />\nChomsky emphasized the priority of generative syntax over semantics in linguistics. When some of his former students proposed generative semantics, Chomsky denounced them with such vehemence that they couldn\u2019t get published in mainstream linguistics journals. Hey, \u201cSyntax without semantics is meaningless.\u201d..<br />\n<br />\nA sentence like \"They criticized the party on the beach\" is ambiguous\u2026<br />\n<br />\nThe consituent \"on the beach\" could relate to either \"the beach\" or \"criticized\", and thus two different parse trees (syntactic interpretations) can describe this sentence..<br />\n<br />\nThe two semantic interpreations corresponding to the trees would be:--<br />\n<br />\nE.g. They criticized the party, which took place on the beach..<br />\nor<br />\nThey criticized the party while walking on the beach..<br />\n<br />\nWhile the first interpretation stands out as more likely, one could imagine a context, where the second interpretation is possible. ..This is why English is a BULLSHIT language ..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: purple;\">Mantras language must have\u2014<br />1) More than 5000 years old<br />2) Accurate expression<br />3) Clear speech and perfect pronunciation<br />4) No changes since it was first made<br />5) Must have a meaning built into every word and hence must have immense vocabulary.<br />6) Must have precise golden ratio sound harmonics ( Fibonacci/ Sri Yantra )<br />7) Mathematical and geometrical precision<br />8) Phonetic\u2014direct link between sound and signs<br />9) Script must be based on the spoken form<br />10) Cannot have spellings like English<br />11) Cannot have silent alphabets<br />12) Words must unfold from seed forms<br />13) Natural continuity is word making<br />14) Natural continuity in sentence making<br />15) Sound must have vibration<br />16) Sounds must have resonance\u2014 (this is just the tip of the iceberg )<br />17) Alphabets must form in cymatics when uttered<br />18) Must not have proper nouns<br />19) Must be polite with no bad words in the un- abridged dictionary<br />20) Mantras in this language must be approved by a gifted seer and the effect felt on his chakras</span><br />\n<br />\nOnly Sanskrit qualifies for all above\u2026<br />\n<br />\nCUNT NOAM CHOMSKY MUST LEARN SANSKRIT \u2013AND THEN BURN ALL HIS BULLSHIT BOOKS ON LINGUISTICS..<br />\n<br />\nThis blogsite does NOT get impressed with Noam Chomsky. The deep structure is converted by transformational rules into a surface structure that corresponds more closely to what is pronounced and heard. The rationale is that certain constructions, if they were listed in the mind as surface structures, would have to be multiplied out in thousands of redundant variations that would have to have been learned one by one, whereas if the constructions were listed as deep structures, they would be simple, few in number, and economically learned.\" ..<br />\n<br />\nBLAH BLAH FUCKIN\u2019 BLAH..<br />\n<br />\nJEW CHOMSKY --THE KING OF ALL OBFUSCATORS ..<br />\n<br />\nTo give NLP an aura of infallibility they had LIED that NLP are all formal models based on mathematical, logical principles such as predicate calculus and the mathematical equations underlying holography. One of them is called the\nAkasa or ether and the other, Prana or energy..&nbsp;\n&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Everything in this universe that\npossesses form or that has material existence, is evolved out of this\nomnipresent and all-pervasive subtle substance \u2018Akasa\u2019. &nbsp;&nbsp;Gas, liquid and solid, the whole universe,\nconsisting of our solar system and millions of huge systems like ours and in\nfact every kind of existence that may be brought under the word \u2018created\u2019, are\nthe products of this one subtle and invisible Akasa and at the end of each\ncycle return to the starting point.&nbsp; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the same way, all the way of forces of\nnature that are known to man; gravitation, light, heat, electricity, magnetism\nall those that can be grouped under the generic name of \u2018energy\u2019, physical\ncreation, nerve-currents, all such as are known as animal forces and thought\nand other intellectual forces , may be said to be the manifestations of the\ncosmic Prana.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conservation of matter and conservation of energy are the two\nfundamental laws of nature.
