The macrocosm (Brahmanda) and microcosm\n(Pindanda) are combinations of Prana (energy) and Akasa (matter).</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is Prana that you\nare breathing rather than the atmospheric air. Inhale slowly and steadily with\na concentrated mind. Retain it as long as you can do it comfortably. Then\nexhale slowly. There should be no strain in any stage of Pranayama.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Realise the\noccult inner life-powers which underlie the breath. Become a Yogi and radiate\njoy, light and power all around you.. Prana is called Jyeshtha and Sreshtha\n(oldest and best) in Upanishads. It is through the vibrations of psychic Prana that\nthe life of the mind, Sankalpa or thinking is kept up and thought is produced.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You see, hear, talk, sense, think, feel, will, know, etc., through the help of\nPrana and therefore Srutis declare: \u201cPrana is Brahman.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The air-sacs of the\nlungs when spread out over an unbroken surface, would cover, an area of\n1,40,000 square feet. The number of respiration per minute is 16. In pneumonia\nit is increased to 60, 70, 80 per minute. In Asthma, the bronchial tubes become\nspasmodic.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lungs purify the blood. The blood starts in its arterial journey,\nbright-red and rich-laden with life-giving qualities and properties.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It returns\nby the venous route, poor, blue-laden with the waste matter of the system. Arteries\nare tubes or vessels that carry pure oxygenated blood from the heart towards\nthe different parts of the body. Veins are vessels or tubes that carry back\nimpure blood from the different parts of the body.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The right side of the heart\ncontains impure venous blood. From the right side of the heart the impure blood\ngoes to the lungs, for purification. It is distributed among the millions of\ntiny air-cells of the lungs.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A breath of air is inhaled and the oxygen of the\nair comes in contact with the impure blood through the thin walls of the\nhair-like blood-vessels of the lungscalled pulmonary capillaries. The walls of\nthe capillaries are very thin.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They are like muslin cloth or sieve. Blood oozes\nout or exudes readily. Oxygen penetrates through the walls of these thin capillaries.\nFrom the arteries the pure blood goes into the thin capillaries. From the\ncapillaries the lymph of the blood exudes, bathes and nourishes the tissues of\nthe body.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tissue respiration takes place in the tissues. Tissues take up the oxygen\nand leave the carbon dioxide. The impurities are taken by the veins to the\nright side of the heart.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sushumna is the most important of all the Nadis. It is\nthe sustainer of the universe and the path of the universe and the path of\nsalvation. Situated at the back of the anus, it is attached to the spinal\ncolumn and extends to the Brahmarandhra of the head and is invisible and\nsubtle.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The real work of a Yogi begins when Sushumna begins to function.\nSushumna runs along the centre of the spinal cord or spinal column.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Above the\ngenital organs and below the navel is the Kanda, of the shape of a bird\u2019s egg.\nThere arise from it all the Nadis 72,000 in number. Of these, seventy-two are common\nand generally known. Of those the chief ones are ten and they carry the Pranas.\nIda, Pingala, Sushumna, Gandhari, Hastijihva, Pusa, Yusasvini, Alambusa, Kuhuh\nand Sankhini are said to be the ten important Nadis.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the coiled-up energy,\nKundalini, passes up along the Sushumna Nadi and is taken up from Chakra to Chakra\nthe Yogi gets different sorts of experiences, powers and Ananda.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kundalini is\nthe serpent power or sleeping Sakti, that has 3 1/2 coils with face downwards, in\nthe Muladhara Chakra, at the base of the spine.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No Samadhi is possible without\nits being awakened.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The practice of Kumbhaka in Pranayama produces heat and\nthereby Kundalini is awakened and passes upwards along the Sushumna Nadi.&nbsp; Then the Kundalini passes along the Six\nChakras and eventually gets united with Lord Siva, seated on the Sahasrara or\nthousand-petalled lotus, at the crown of the head.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nirvikalpa Samadhi ensues\nnow and the Yogi gets liberation and all the divine Aishvaryas. One should practice\ncontrol of breath with concentration of mind.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kundalini is like a thread and is\nresplendent. When it is awakened it hisses like a serpent beaten with a stick\nand enters the hole of Sushumna. When it travels from Chakra to Chakra, layer after\nlayer of the mind becomes open and the Yogi acquires various Siddhis (psychic\npowers).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chakras are centres of spiritual energy. They are located in the\nastral body, but they have corresponding centres in the physical body also.\nThey can hardly be seen by the naked eyes. Only a clairvoyant can see with his\nastral eyes. Tentatively they correspond to certain plexuses in the physical\nbody.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are six important Chakras. They are: Muladhara (containing 4\npetals) at the anus; Svadhishthana (6 petals) at the genital organ; Manipura\n(10 petals) at navel; Anahata (12 petals) at the heart; Visudha (16 petals) at\nthe throat and Ajna (2 petals) at the space between the two eyebrows. The\nseventh Chakra is known as Sahasrara, which contains a thousand petals&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Yogi\nshould take his food at a time when Surya Nadi or Pingala is working, i.e.,\nwhen the breath flows through the right nostril, because Pingala is heating and\ndigests the food quickly.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pranayama should not be practised just after taking meals,\nnor when one is very hungry.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For many of us, deep breathing seems unnatural.\nThere are several reasons for this. For one, body image has a negative impact\non respiration in our culture. A flat stomach is considered attractive, so\nwomen (and men) tend to hold in their stomach muscles.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This interferes with\ndeep breathing and gradually makes shallow \u201cchest breathing\u201d seem normal, which\nincreases tension and anxiety. Shallow breathing limits the diaphragm\u2019s range\nof motion. The lowest part of the lungs doesn\u2019t get a full share of oxygenated\nair. That can make you feel short of breath and anxious. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Deep abdominal\nbreathing encourages full oxygen exchange \u2014 that is, the beneficial trade of\nincoming oxygen for outgoing carbon dioxide. Not surprisingly, it can slow the\nheartbeat and lower or stabilize blood pressure.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rapid breathing (\nhyperventilation ) is controlled by the sympathetic nervous system. It\u2019s part\nof the \u201cfight or flight\u201d response \u2014 the part activated by stress.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">LONG AGO, WE WERE IN THE RIVER THAMES</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">MY THIRD MATE CALLED ME ON THE TELEPHONE AND SAID THAT THE BRITISH PILOT IS RACIST AND HE CALLS INDIANS SUPERSTITIOUS SAVAGES</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">SO PRETTY SOON WAS ON THE BRIDGE</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">THE FAT PILOT ( OLD MAN ) WAS SITTING ON THE PILOT CHAIR-- USING A ROSARY AND MUTTERING SOMETHING (LIKE HOLY GHOST FATHER SON--WHATEVER )</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">SO I ASKED HIM-- HOW MANY BEADS DOES YOUR ROSARY HAVE ?</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">HE SAID --I DONT KNOW--HIS PRIEST GAVE IT TO HIM</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">SO I TOLD HIM, EVERY ROSARY ON THE PLANET -- OF ANY RELIGION HAS 108 BEADS-- AS THIS NUMBER REPRESENTS OM-- THE HINDU KING MANTRA</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">HE COUNTED THE BEADS AND SAID-- YOU ARE RIGHT CAPTAIN , THERE ARE 108 BEADS IN MY ROSARY</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">THEN I ASKED HIM-- HOW MANY PORTALS DOES YOUR STONEHENGE HAVE ?</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">HE SAID-- I DONT KNOW</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">THEN HE QUICKLY PUT ON HIS LAPTOP , COUNTED AND SAID -- 27 PORTALS</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">I SAID-- THESE ARE THE 27 NAKSHATRAS OF HINDU ASTRONOMY.</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">EACH NAKSHATRA HAS 4 PADAS .&nbsp; SO 27 X 4 = 108&nbsp;&nbsp;</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">YOUR STONEHENGE WAS MADE BY HINDU SAGES --AND THIS STRUCTURE REPRESENTS OM&nbsp;</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">THIS PILOT WAS TOTALLY TAKEN ABACK -- HE DID NOT EVEN WANT TO CONTEST ---</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">&nbsp;HE APOLOGIZED TO MY THIRD MATE FOR CALLING INDIANS SUPERSTITIOUS SAVAGES.</b><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-2RCk_sSPq1Y/Wns10sTOBPI/AAAAAAABYb4/kZT0MF59FrUFsE0XYXmgNO1e11pcBOVFgCLcBGAs/s1600/nakjksatra-graha.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"1597\" data-original-width=\"1600\" height=\"638\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-2RCk_sSPq1Y/Wns10sTOBPI/AAAAAAABYb4/kZT0MF59FrUFsE0XYXmgNO1e11pcBOVFgCLcBGAs/s640/nakjksatra-graha.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br style=\"background-color: #b7620e; color: #650000; font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, &quot;Book Antiqua&quot;, sans-serif; font-size: 15.2px; text-align: justify;\" />\n<br />\n<table class=\"dpPgTbl\" style=\"background-color: #b7620e; border-spacing: 1px; border: 2px solid rgb(135, 28, 2); color: #650000; font-family: Verdana, Geneva, Arial, &quot;Book Antiqua&quot;, sans-serif; font-size: 15.2px; margin: 0px auto; padding: 0px; vertical-align: top; width: 750px;\"><tbody>\n<tr style=\"border-collapse: collapse; border-spacing: 0px; border: 0px; margin: 0px auto; text-align: vertical-align: middle; width: 28px;\">No</th><th style=\"background-color: #871c02; border-collapse: separate; border-spacing: 1px; color: #ffc154; font-size: 0.9em; padding: 3px 0px 3px 10px; text-align: left; vertical-align: middle; width: 251px;\">Nakshatra Name</th><th style=\"background-color: #871c02; border-collapse: separate; border-spacing: 1px; color: #ffc154; font-size: 0.9em; padding: 3px 0px 3px 10px; text-align: left; vertical-align: middle; width: 101px;\">Pada 1</th><th style=\"background-color: #871c02; border-collapse: separate; border-spacing: 1px; color: #ffc154; font-size: 0.9em; padding: 3px 0px 3px 10px; text-align: left; vertical-align: middle; width: 101px;\">Pada 2</th><th style=\"background-color: #871c02; border-collapse: separate; border-spacing: 1px; color: #ffc154; font-size: 0.9em; padding: 3px 0px 3px 10px; text-align: left; vertical-align: middle; width: 101px;\">Pada 3</th><th style=\"background-color: #871c02; border-collapse: separate; border-spacing: 1px; color: #ffc154; font-size: 0.9em; padding: 3px 0px 3px 10px; text-align: left; vertical-align: middle; width: 101px;\">Pada 4</th></tr>\n<tr style=\"border-collapse: collapse; border-spacing: 0px; border: 0px; margin: 0px auto; text-align: center; width: 750px;\"><td style=\"background-color: #fac97b; border-collapse: separate; border-spacing: 1px; border: 0px; font-size: 0.9em; margin: 0px auto; padding: 3px 0px 3px 10px; text-align: left; vertical-align: middle; width: 28px;\">1.</td><td style=\"background-color: #fac97b; border-collapse: separate; border-spacing: 1px; border: 0px; font-size: 0.9em; margin: 0px auto; padding: 3px 0px 3px 10px; text-align: left; vertical-align: middle; width: 251px;\">Ashwini, \u0905\u0936\u094d\u0935\u093f\u0928\u0940</td><td style=\"background-color: #fac97b; border-collapse: separate; border-spacing: 1px; border: 0px; margin: 0px auto; padding: 3px 0px 3px 10px; text-align: left; vertical-align: middle; width: 101px;\"><a href=\"https://www.drikpanchang.com/swar-siddhanta/nakshatra/ashwini/names-with-swar-chu.html\" style=\"color: #aa0000; text-decoration-line: none;\" title=\"Names starting with Chu\"><table class=\"dpPgTbl\" style=\"border-spacing: 1px; border: 0px; margin: 0px auto; padding: 0px; vertical-align: top; width: 101px;\"><tbody>\n<tr style=\"border-collapse: collapse; />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each of the 27\nNakshatra is divided into four Pada = 4 quarters. 27 x 4 = 108= digital value\nof OM. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">108 IS A DIVINE NUMBER\n--. NOBODY CAN STEAL THIS NUMBER AND GIVE IT TO ANY OTHER LAND OTHER THAN\nINDIA, OR RELIGION OTHER THAN SANATANA DHARMA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every Nakshatra\nmeasures 13.20' (13 degrees and 20 minutes). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each Nakshatra is\ndivided into 4 parts of 3.20' (3 degrees and 20 minutes). These parts are\ncalled padas (charan )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>As per our Hindu\nMythology, Moon had married all the 27 daughters of King Dakshan, who are the\n27 nakshatras in the sky. But, Moon loved to spend time with only one his\nbeloved queen Rohini Nakshtara, which is also the exaltation point for Moon.\nOther wives (Nakshtras) complained to their father (King Dakshan), repeated\nrequested to Moon by King was unable to change Moon's nature, finally King\nDakshan got angry and cursed Moon, causing it to wane in size. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Moon started\ndiminishing in size. Since the consequences of this was not good, all Devas\nintervened and requested King Dakshan to withdraw the curse. King was given\nassurance that Moon will visit all his wives, since the curse cannot be revoked\ncompletely, King Dakshan said Moon will regained his strength for half a month,\nthat is the reason Moon transits all 27 nakshtras in a month, completing the\nzodiac orbit causing Amavasya and Poornima by waxing and waning in size.</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 27 nakshatras, each\nwith 4 padas, give 108, which is the number of beads in a japa mala,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each zodiac sign has a\ntotal of 9 padas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are 12 zodiac\nsigns. So, 12*9 = 108 padas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each nakshatra has 4\npadas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Span of each pada is 3\u00b0\n20\u2032. So, 3\u00b0 20\u2032*4 = 13\u00b0 20\u2032(which is the span of one nakshatra)</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/108-numerical-equivalent-of-hindu-king.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/108-numerical-equivalent-of-hindu-king.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">W hen we use the word\n'swara', we are talking &nbsp;about something\nmore than the air which flows from &nbsp;the\nnostrils, we are also talking about the flow of prana, a very &nbsp;subtle and vital aspect of the breath.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swara yoga is the\nancient science of pranic body rhythms &nbsp;which\nexplains how the movement of prana can be controlled &nbsp;by manipulation of the breath. With exciting\ndevelopments accelerating in such areas</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As bioenergetics,\npsychotronics and Kirlian photography, the science of swara yoga is now in\ngreat demand. Swara etymologically means 'the sound of one's own &nbsp;breath'. Yoga means 'union'.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Therefore, swara\nyoga enables &nbsp;the state of union to be\nreached by means of one's breath. Through the practice of swara yoga, one can\nrealize the &nbsp;breath as being the medium\nof the cosmic life force ..The &nbsp;breath\nhas so much importance in human existence that the &nbsp;ancient rishis or seers evolved a complete\nscience around it just from studying the simple process of respiration. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swara yoga, however, should\nnot be confused with &nbsp;pranayama, which\ninvolves a different aspect of the breath. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although both deal with\nprana, swara yoga emphasizes the &nbsp;analysis\nof the breath and the significance of different pranic &nbsp;rhythms, whereas pranayama involves techniques\nto redirect, &nbsp;store and control prana.\nSwara yoga may therefore be said to &nbsp;involve\nthe practices of pranayama, but in fact it is a much &nbsp;more extensive and precise science.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva Swarodaya &nbsp;extols the significance of &nbsp;the different types of breath or pranic\nrhythms as told by &nbsp;Lord Shiva to his\nwife Shakti.&nbsp; Mind you, both are cosmic\nallegories.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swara yoga explains how\nthe flow of the swara changes at &nbsp;regular\nintervals; it is not at all erratic. Every 90 minutes the active nostril\nchanges. This &nbsp;rhythm regulates all the\npsychological and physiological &nbsp;processes.\nIf the swara is irregular, it is a clear indication &nbsp;that something is not functioning properly in\nthe body.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One swara flows through\nthe left nostril, &nbsp;another flows through\nthe right, and the third flows through both nostrils together. The different\nswaras influence us in various ways by stimulating different energy centres and\naspects of the nervous system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The&nbsp; Swara Yogi can shift his dominant nostril at\nwill. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Hyperventilation is allowed in Yoga only to\nshift the predominant nostril.. . Thus, swara yoga aims at harmonizing the mind\nand body by adjusting the actions with the &nbsp;swara. The left nostril is connected to the\nida network of nadis, the &nbsp;right nostril\nto pingala, and when both nostrils function &nbsp;together, the main channel or sushumna network\nis &nbsp;stimulated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In fact, it is not just\nby chance that the swara flows &nbsp;sometimes\nthrough the right nostril and at other times &nbsp;through the left. The rhythm of the body is\nbased on the &nbsp;biorhythms, the energy\nrhythms of the body, and it also relates to the two hemispheres of the brain. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In swara yoga, mind is known as chitta, life &nbsp;force as prana and spirit as atma. Chitta\ncontrols the sensory &nbsp;nerves: the eyes,\nnose, tongue, ears and skin. Prana controls &nbsp;the five organs of action: speech, hands,\nfeet, reproductive &nbsp;and urinary/excretory\norgans.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Atma is the overall witness or &nbsp;controller.\nWhen the left nostril flows, it indicates that the mental &nbsp;energy, chitta, is predominant, and the pranic\nenergy is &nbsp;weak. When the right nostril\nflows, the pranic forces are &nbsp;stronger\nand the mental aspect is weak. When both nostrils &nbsp;operate together, it indicates that the\nspiritual energy, the &nbsp;force of the atma,\nis in power.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the tantric\ntradition Lord Shiva, who is known as Adinath (the primordial guru), first\nexpounded the knowledge &nbsp;of swara to his\ndisciple, his wife.. Shiva implores Shakti ( wife ) to make sure that the\nscience is kept &nbsp;very secret and sacred,\nand remains the highest of all the &nbsp;vidyas\nor forms of knowledge. Lord Shiva further states that &nbsp;in all the seven lokas he knows no greater\nwisdom or treasure &nbsp;than the swara.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you ever take the\ntime to observe the breath and the &nbsp;manner\nin which the air flows in and out of the nostrils, you &nbsp;will notice that most of the time respiration\ntakes place &nbsp;through one nostril only. It\nappears that respiration occurs &nbsp;through\nboth nostrils simultaneously, but this is not so. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you observe the breath, you will find\nthat one nostril &nbsp;usually remains open\nfor a certain duration of time and the &nbsp;breath\ncomes and goes through that side only. Later this &nbsp;nostril closes and the alternate nostril\nopens. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What does this mean?\nPhysiologically, it has a particular &nbsp;effect\non the nervous system, producing a certain type of &nbsp;stimulus. Furthermore, it has a specific\ninfluence on the &nbsp;brain which requires\nvery systematic regulation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Upanishads refer to\nswara as atmaswaroopa or brahmaswaroopa, thus inferring that man is a part of\nBrahman or &nbsp;the universal consciousness.\nIf you can realize the true &nbsp;reality of\nthe breath, you can realize the atma or soul. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ordinary breathing is a\nmechanical function performed by &nbsp;the\nphysical body, but in swara yoga breathing is a process which can be\nmanipulated and controlled.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the swara\nshastras, by analysis of the breath deeper understanding of the cosmos is unfolded\nand the wisdom revealed within the Vedas can be realized. Through knowledge of\nthe swara, a sadhaka can become a perfected yogi. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Effects of swara yoga\nare also very subtle. It aims at directly awakening the highest human\npotential.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Swara yoga is a path which leads to total\nexperience and awakening of the entire being. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The energy flows\ncreated by the left and right swaras act &nbsp;something like the positive and negative\ncurrents in an &nbsp;electrical circuit. The\nleft swara is the negative line, while &nbsp;the\nright is the positive. When the right nostril is flowing, it &nbsp;is said that pingala stimulates the body. When\nthe left nostril &nbsp;is flowing, ida\nstimulates the mental faculties.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the time when the swara is alternating,\nboth nostrils become &nbsp;active\nsimultaneously. Then sushumna nadi is said to &nbsp;stimulate the atma or spiritual potential. But\nthis usually &nbsp;occurs only during the\nperiod of changeover for a couple of &nbsp;minutes.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If either swara\npredominates for too long it is a sign of warning that one of the branches of\nthe autonomic nervous system is being over stressed and only one of the brain\nhemispheres is being fully utilized. The co-ordination of these three Nadis gives health, strength, mental peace and long life - and clear the way for the\nspiritual growth. Once this understanding takes place, the breathing pattern\ncan be altered at will to make the life harmonious and balanced.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sushumna nadi is the\ncause of spiritual actions and it is &nbsp;the\npurpose of every yogic and tantric system to activate it. Sushumna runs\nstraight up the centre of the spine and &nbsp;merges\nwith ida and pingala a little above the nasal root at &nbsp;ajna chakra, the point behind the eyebrow\ncentre.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is &nbsp;through sushumna that the\nkundalini shakti, the high- powered spiritual force, has to be channelled. When\nboth &nbsp;nostrils are active, it is an\nindication that the sushumna &nbsp;passage is\nopen. Therefore, equalizing the breath is important for it is associated with\nthe opening of sushumna nadi. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When sushumna flows,\nthe mental and physical energy &nbsp;patterns\nbecome even and rhythmic, the thoughts are stilled &nbsp;and the mind is calm. Therefore, it is also\nknown as the &nbsp;shoonya swara. Shoonya\nmeans void. For the yogi this is the &nbsp;most\nsignificant type of swara because it aids in the practice &nbsp;of dhyana or meditation. The aim of swara yoga\nis therefore &nbsp;to develop the shoonya\nswara by reducing the activities of &nbsp;the\nalternating breath. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are many\ntechniques for controlling the swara so &nbsp;that\nduring the day the left nostril remains active and prana &nbsp;moves in a particular direction. Or by making\nthe prana &nbsp;flow through the right nostril\nduring the night you can &nbsp;create another\ntype of energy movement and stimulus, so &nbsp;that you can have a good sleep without\ntranquillizers, work &nbsp;the whole day\nwithout becoming fatigued, or you can digest &nbsp;food without taking appetisers or digestives.\nThese are all &nbsp;different aspects of swara\nyoga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you are\nmeditating, praying or contemplating &nbsp;the\ntruth, it is spiritual action. When you are walking, talking, &nbsp;urinating or eating, it is physical action.\nWhen digestion is &nbsp;going on and the\nenzymes are flowing in the body, it is &nbsp;physical\naction. But when you are worried or have many &nbsp;thoughts on your mind, or when you are\nmemorizing a &nbsp;poem or song, or planning\nsomething, it is mental action. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whether you have\ncompassion in your mind or you are &nbsp;angry\nwith somebody, it is all mental action. These are just a &nbsp;lew examples of the three categories of\naction. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The left swara presides\nover &nbsp;mental actions, the right swara\nover physical actions, and &nbsp;both swaras\ntogether preside over spiritual actions. Sleeping on the left side opens the\nright nostril, while sleeping on the right side opens the flow through the left\nnostril. Putting a small cushion under the armpit and pressing it with your\nbodyweight will help you further.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Inhalation through the\nactive nostril and exhalation through the inactive nostril helps to change the\ndominance. In order to maintain balance and harmony of body, mind, and prana,\nthe practice Nadi Shodhana Pranayama (alternate-nostril breath) is considered\nvery helpful. It helps in balancing the flow of the breath and re-establishes\nthe natural nasal cycle. It also brings regularity in the inner body system and\ndevelops complete control over all pranic and mental activities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NADI SHODHANA PRANAYAMA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sit in a comfortable\nposition steadily. Keep the palm of the right hand facing the face. Bend the\nfirst two fingers next to the thumb inside. Now put the right thumb on the\nright nostril and last two fingers of the same hand should be used to press the\nleft nostril. Remember, for the practice of this Pranayama always start &amp;\nfinish the breathing from the left nostril.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TECHNIQUE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. Breathe in through\nthe left nostril. Close the left nostril with the ring &amp; little fingers and\nbreathe out through the right nostril.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. Breathe in through\nthe right nostril. Close the right nostril with the thumb &amp; breathe out\nthrough the left nostril.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. This completes one\nround of Nadi Shodhana.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SWARA YOGA WHEN\nMASTERED KEEPS YOU IN THE ZONE \u2013IN THE FLOW.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SWARA IS RELATED TO\nMOON PHASE WHEN IT COMES TO WOMEN<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tattwa sadhana involves\nanalyzing the breath <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The philosophy of yoga\nexplains how the whole universe is the composition of the five elements, or\nTattwas of prithvi (earth), Jalas (water), Agni (fire). Vayu (air) and Akasha\n(ether).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The human body, being composed of the same stuff as the universe,\ntherefore reflects the properties of these elements through every cell. In\nSwara yoga a more detailed explanation is given, for it says that these\nelements, which are \u2018hidden in a subtler level of existence\u2019, can easily be\nrecognized by the nature of the outgoing breath.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Shiva Swarodaya, &nbsp;which went on ora route alone &nbsp;consists of 395 sutras with amazingly detailed\ndescriptions of various practical aspects which can be easily learnt and\npracticed by a modern scientific man with confirmatory tests.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The practice of\nShiva Swarodaya allows us to synchronize our breath with the universal rhythm.\nThis alignment removes undue efforts, stress and strain from our daily\nactivities.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva tells his wife --\nNow I will describe the science of the origin of the swaras which reside in the\nbody. With the knowledge of the swaras, which move in the form of HAMSO (i.e.\nthe sound of the outgoing HAM and incoming SO breath), one acquires knowledge\nof the past, present and future. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIS IS WHAT RASCAL AND\nFAKE GURU SRI SRI RAVISHANKAR IS PEDDLING AS SOHUM \u201cSUDARSHAN KRIYA \u201c\nHYPERVENTILATION\u2014WHICH CAN KILL YOU.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/hyperventilation-followed-by-valsalva.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/hyperventilation-followed-by-valsalva.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Shiva tells his wife in\nShiva Swarodaya &nbsp;( just a peek\u2014CHAATNE KE\nVAASTE &nbsp;) \u2014\u201c &nbsp;O lady of beautiful face, all the shastras,\npuranas, smritis and the vedangas are nothing beyond the knowledge of swara. The\nSwarodaya shastra is the best of all scriptures<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Within the swara are\nthe three planes of existence (conscious, subconscious, unconscious). Swara is\nverily the atma (self-illumined). Within the swara the entire Vedas, shastras\nand musical knowledge are contained. Everything is meaningless without the\nknowledge of swara. An astrologer without the knowledge of swara isas useless\nas a masterless house, a mouth without scriptures or a headless body.&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The one\nwho has discrimination regarding the nadis,prana, tattwas and sushumna has the\nright to attain liberation. . In the macro and microcosmos all are created only\nby the swara, which is also the cause of creation and dissolution..&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>There has\nneither been seen nor heard anything more confidential, more valuable or more\nknowledgeable than the knowledge of swara. Ida nadi is on the left side of the\nbody, pingala on the right side, sushumna in the centre, and gandhari in the\nleft eye.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>&nbsp;Hastijihva is in the right eye, poosha in the\nright ear, yashaswini in the left ear, alambusha in the mouth.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>&nbsp;Kuhu is in the reproductive organs and\nshankhini in the anal region. In this manner all these ten nadis are situated\nin the openings of the body. &nbsp;When you\nexhale, the sound is Ha and when you inhale the sound is SA. &nbsp;HA is in the form of Shiva (consciousness) and\nSA is in the form of Shakti (energy).&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The controller of the flow of the left\nnadi is the moon who also resides in it in the form of Shakti. The controller\nof the flow of the right nadi is the sun in the form of Shambhu (Shiva). Those\nwho always practice thoroughly controlling their lunar and solar nadis have\nknowledge of past and future ready at hand.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>&nbsp;Ida nadi on the left is like amrit (nectar)\nand the giver of strength and nourishment. Pingala on the right is responsible\nfor all creativity. . Chandra, the lunar flow, is the female principle; and\nsurya, the solar flow, is the male principle.&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Understand that the moon is\nShakti, the sun is Shiva. The complexion of the moon is fair and that of the\nsun is dark. During the flow of chandra nadi (ida), placid works should be\ndone.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>&nbsp;During the flow of surya nadi, difficult and\nhard works should be done. During the flow of sushumna those actions leading to\nbhukti (sensual enjoyment) and mukti (liberation) should be undertaken.&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>During\nthe first three days of the bright fortnight, the lunar nadi flows first and\nthen alternates. In the first three days of the dark fortnight, the solar nadi\nflows first and then alternates. From this order you should know the rising\ntime of the swara. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The earth element is\nconcerned with the stars and constellations (nakshatras) of: Dhanishta\n(Delphini), Rohini (Aldebaran), Jyeshtha (Antares), Anuradha (Scorpionis),\nShravana (Aquitae), Abhijit (Vega) and Uttarashadha (Sagittari). <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>O dear one, the water\nelement is concerned with the stars and constellations of: Poorvashadha\n(Sagittari), Aslesha (Hydarae), Moola (Scorpionis), Ardra (Betelguese), Revati\n(Piscum), Uttarabhadrapada (Andromedae) and Shatabhishaj (Aquari).<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>O beloved one, the\nstars and constellations concerned with the fire element are: Bharani\n(Arietis), Krittika (Tauri), Pushya (Cancri), Magha (Regulas), Poorvaphalguni\n(Leonis), Poorvabhadrapada (Pegasi) and Swati (Bootis). <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The stars and\nconstellations concerned with the air element are: Vishakha (Librae),\nUttaraphalguni (Lionis), Hasta (Corvi), Chitra (Virginis), Punarvasu\n(Geminorium), Ashwini (Castor and Pollux) and Mrigashirsha (Orionis).<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Lam is the seed mantra\nof the earth element. One should concentrate on this element which has a\nshining yellow-colored square, a pleasant smell and a golden light. By this one\ncan obtain lightness of body.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Vam is the bija mantra\nof the water element. By concentrating on it and the form of a shining crescent\nmoon, hunger and thirst can be overcome, and one can stay for a long time under\nwater. Thus one has power over water.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>One who concentrates on\nthe bij a mantra Ram of the fire element situated in a shining red triangle can\neat and drink colossal amounts of food, and bear the heat of the sun or fire.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>&nbsp;Yam, the bija mantra of the air element,\nshould be meditated upon. It is circular and blue or dark in color. The person\nwho has power over it can move through the air, fly like a bird (experience\nlevitation).<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>&nbsp;For concentration on the ether element, which\nis formless and multicolored, one uses the bija mantra Ham. Through these\npractices comes the knowledge of past, present and future and gain of\nprosperity, jewels, gems, etc.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>ABOVE IS JUST A PEEK \u2013\nREMEMBER !</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">IT TALKS ABOUT HOW TO\nHAVE A MALE CHILD \u2013 OR HOW TO HAVE SEX AND NOT HAVE A CHILD \u2013 OR HOW TO HAVE AN\nIMPOTENT CHILD-- I WONT TELL THIS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE STARS SHOW THAT\nSWARA YOGIS WERE ALSO EXPERT ASTRONOMERS/ ASROLOGERS <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">IF PATANJALIs YOGA\nSUTRAS WERE LKG STUFF \u2014 SHIVA SWARODAYA IS PHD STUFF\u2014MIGHTY AND MINDBOGGLING <o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">PATANJALIs YOGA SUTRAS\nARE BELOW\u2014I HAVE ALREADY WRITTEN ABOUT IT IN MY SANATANA&nbsp; DHARMA SERIES</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a
