class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_30.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_30.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_31.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/07/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_31.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/08/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/08/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/08/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_2.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/08/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_2.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/08/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_5.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/08/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_5.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/08/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_9.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/08/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_9.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/08/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_14.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/08/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_14.html</a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 250%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; line-height: 115%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/08/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_17.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/08/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_17.html</a></span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prana is not stagnant\u2014it\nis a &nbsp;force in constant motion, like a &nbsp;vibration moving to and fro without any\ninterception.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Prana has two aspects -\ncosmic and individual. Cosmic prana is </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">very\nsubtle and can only be perceived by the infinite mind of a Jivan Mukt, </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">but individual prana related to the body is\ngrosser and more </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">tangible.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the order\nof creation, prana emanates from the &nbsp;unmanifest\nreality known as hiranyagarbha, the golden womb &nbsp;or egg. On the physical level it manifests as\nindividual &nbsp;existence.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Swara yoga develops\nawareness of the manifestation and existence of prana within our own being so\nthat we </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">can come to realize its cosmic\npropensity.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In yoga, breathing is considered\nto be a very important &nbsp;process because\nit is the most vital means of absorbing &nbsp;prana\ninto the body. The shastras explain how prana gives &nbsp;consciousness and life to every creature which\nbreathes. In &nbsp;the Taittiriya, Brahmana\nand Maitri Upanishads and Shiva &nbsp;Swarodaya,\nthe breath is referred to as the vehicle of Brahman or cosmic consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prashnopanishad, which specifically\naims at clarifying the nature of creation, explains that, \"Prana brings\nfrom the atman and is as inseparable from the self as the shadow is from he who\ncasts the shadow.\"</span> &nbsp;&nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through\nthe practice of Swara yoga, we are attempting to experience the grosser aspect\nof prana in order to trace it back to its original source<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In most of the yogic\ntexts the term prana is associated with life force or bioenergy.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Matter\nhas many stages of existence and manifestation. At one level it is inert. In\nthe process of evolution it manifests life. Later it manifests consciousness,\nthen energy emerges and the final manifestation is knowledge and experience. This\nis the truth about both physics and metaphysics, about science, tantra and\nswara yoga.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to swara yoga\nthe body is a storehouse of vital energy, a dynamo with infinite electrical\ncurrents flowing throughout. The ordinary man sees this body as a combination\nof flesh, blood and bone. But the yogis and scientists have perceived a greater\nforce behind the physical elements, and that is the force of energy or prana.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Maharishis with 12\nstrand DNA found that there is an energy link between the physical and psychic\nbodies.&nbsp; They found out that&nbsp; that energy or pranic force is convertible\ninto material force and that material force is convertible into pranic force.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You know the famous equation of Albert Einstein, E = mc 2 , that matter is energy\nin its potential state. This is an ancient truth written down in the Vedas 7000\nyears ago.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">Every single thing for\nwhich Jew Albert Einstein was awarded was stolen from the Vedas. He just gave a\nMath veneer to it. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\">Albert Einstein was\nVERY VERY POOR IN MATH &nbsp;--he outsourced\nhis Math to India.. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Einstein outsourced his\nmath to his first wife Serbian Mathematician Mileva Maric (older than him by 4\nyears ) , Marcel Grossmann, Satyendranath Bose and the students of Calcutta\nUniversity\u2014the Indian vice chancellor would be knighted by Rothschild in\ngratitude. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sir Ashutosh Mukherjee ,\nthe second Indian Vice-Chancellor of the University of Calcutta for four\nconsecutive two-year terms (1906\u20131914) and a fifth two-year term (1921\u201323)..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">The Calcutta Mathematical Society was also founded by Mukherjee in 1908 (with a\nsinister purpose of helping white Jews &nbsp;)\nand he served as the president of the Society from 1908 to 1923.. &nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Ashutosh baby became a member of the London\nMathematical Society, the Paris Mathematical Society and the American\nMathematical Society (1900).&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Whenever Jew Albert Einstein wanted help with his\nMath\u2014the students of this fellow Sir Ashutosh Mukherjee did all the work.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Syama\nPrasad Mookerjee, the mentor of Atal Bihari Vajpayee was the son of Sir\nAshutosh Mukherjee.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/yellapragada-subbarow-nobel-prize-and.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/yellapragada-subbarow-nobel-prize-and.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>The 108 elements have\nBrahman and Prana within.&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>It is recorded\nin 7000 year old Vedas that if an object is devoid of prana, it will\ndisintegrate.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/perpetual-motion-of-orbiting-electrons.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/perpetual-motion-of-orbiting-electrons.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Science has come to the\nsame conclusion that every existing thing is a composite structure of energy\nand matter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">When a\nperson is calm and relaxed, the pranic emanations are steady and elongated. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">But\nwhen the person becomes anxious, the aura becomes flared and jagged.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">In swara yoga it is said that when there\nis no longer any indication of prana,( loss of aura \u2013 chakras become stationary\u2014soul\nexits &nbsp;) death will ensue.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swara\nyogis devised different practices to increase the pranic capacity and pranic\nfield or aura. These practices enable us to perceive the subtlety of our\nexistence in relation to the universe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">THE\nSOUL OF MAHARISHI SWARA YOGIS COULD EXIT THE BODY ( LIVING ) \u2013TAKE A ASTRAL\nFLIGHT , RE-ENTER THE BODY AND ENERGISE IT BACK TO NORMAL .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: white; color: blue; font-size: large;\">THIS\nBODY FROM WHICH THE SOUL EXITED FOR ASTRAL FIGHT HELD ENOUGH PRANA TO KEEP SPINNING THE CHAKRAS AND MAINTAIN AN AURA</span></b><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the external air\ncomes into contact with the nasal passages, minute nerve detectors situated in the\nmucous membrane of the nose relay impulses to the brain and energy circuits.\nSwara yoga says that by manipulation of the breath flowing in and out through\nthe nose you can regulate the inner body mechanisms and develop complete\ncontrol over all pranic and mental activities. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Scientific\ninvestigations have shown that many autonomic and voluntary functions are\nrelated to the breath and these nerve components situated at the base of the nose.\nIn fact, it has been reported that the nerves in the nasal mucosa are connected\nwith the visceral, excretory and reproductive organs. Improper breathing and\nirregularity of the breath in the nostrils can create a disturbance in any of\nthese organs and vice versa<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>Obstruction of the\nnasal passage affects the lympatic system as per Swara Yoga</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">YOGA&nbsp; AND AYURVEDA WAS THE FIRST TO RECORD THAT THE\nBODY HAS A LYMPH FLUID SYSTEM WHICH DID NOT HAVE A PUMP ( LIKE THE HEART )</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/aIQzn_pMBmQ/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/aIQzn_pMBmQ?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since there is no pump,\nthe lymph movement relies on contraction of smooth muscle tissue lining the\nwalls of lymph vessels. In order to clear the \u201clymph\u201d (the clear extra cellular\nfluid that is collected by the lymphatic vessels and filtered by the lymph\nnodes), the lymphatic system must be pumped manually by yoga asanas ..</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When\nthe lymphatic system operates at its optimum, it's like a free-flowing river</span>\ndespite <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">the\npresence of hundreds of lymph nodes which tries to slow down the lymph fluid .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The west never knew why yogis did complicated asanas till they came to India\nand learnt bout the lymphatic system..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The lymph system is an important part of\nour immune system.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The lymphatic system defends your body\nagainst disease by removing germs (bacteria, viruses and parasites) and toxins\n(poisons). It also helps to destroy cells that are old, damaged or have become\nabnormal.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lymph is a clear fluid that flows around the body in\nthe lymphatic system. It is formed from plasma. Plasma is carried around your\nbody in your blood vessels. It leaks out of the blood vessels and bathes your\ntissues and supplies the cells of your body with nutrients. Most of this plasma\nthen drains back into the blood vessels.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lymph vessels in the\nsmall intestine also absorb fats and fat-soluble vitamins.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nlymph nodes contain lots of lymphocytes (white blood cells that fight\ninfection). Anything that doesn\u2019t belong in your body, and any damaged and\nabnormal cells are removed in the lymph nodes. Lymph leaving the lymph nodes\nalso carries lymphocytes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These lymphocytes can fight infections elsewhere in\nthe body if needed.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the lymph reaches the lymphatic\nducts, it goes into your bloodstream, draining into the large veins close to\nyour heart. This removes excess fluid from around your body, helping to\nmaintain your blood pressure and to avoid swelling.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unlike\nblood, lymph is not pumped around your body by the heart. Instead, it is pushed\nalong when your lymph vessels are squeezed by your muscles, and by gravity if\nthe vessel is above the heart. It is a one-way system: valves stop any lymph\nflowing backwards.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">KALARI MARMAS TARGETTED\nTHE LYMPH NODE SYSTEM.. ONE BLOW ON A MARMA\u2014THE MAN WILL BLOAT UP AND DIE</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/08/yoga-and-ayurvedic-massage-for-draining.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/08/yoga-and-ayurvedic-massage-for-draining.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The proportion of autonomic\nnerve fibres in the nasal cavity is more than twenty times greater than in the\nother parts of the central nervous system. Therefore, the nose has been described\nas a 'peripheral organ of the autonomic nervous system<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The nasal cavity\n(nasal fossa, or nasal passage) is a large air filled space above and behind\nthe nose in the middle of the face. Each cavity is the continuation of one of\nthe two nostrils. The two nasal cavities condition the air to be received by\nthe other areas of the respiratory tract.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Owing to the large surface area\nprovided by the nasal conchae (also known as turbinates), the air passing\nthrough the nasal cavity is warmed or cooled to within 1 degree of body\ntemperature. In addition, the air is humidified, and dust and other particulate\nmatter is removed by vibrissae, short, thick hairs, present in the vestibule.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The entire mucosa of the nasal fossae is covered by a blanket of mucus, which lies\nsuperficial to the microscopic cilia and also filters inspired air. The cilia\nof the respiratory epithelium move the secreted mucus and particulate matter\nposteriorly towards the pharynx where it passes into the esophagus and is\ndigested in the stomach.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The nasal cavity also houses the sense of smell and\ncontributes greatly to taste sensation through its posterior communication with\nthe mouth via the choanae. There is a rich blood supply to the nasal cavity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">. The Hatha Yoga\nPradipika&nbsp; states ---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"when breathing is\ndisturbed, the mind also becomes&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">disturbed. Control of\nthe breath enables steadiness of mind.\"-</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">( 2 : 2 )</span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the sense of smell\nis triggered off by an actual chemical odour, certain impulses are sent to the\nolfactory nerve and the rhinencephalon, the centre which stimulates instinctive\nresponses of fear, aggression, pain and particularly sexual behaviour.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In most primitive\nvertebrates the brain registers the majority of information by smell. Thus the\nrhinencephalon is known as the 'smell brain'. Smell activates many of our\nnatural and spontaneous reactions, but because we also have higher faculties of\nawareness and intellect, its influence is far less than in other primates. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nevertheless, it has\nbeen found that the influence of particular chemical odours can create certain\nemotional reactions within the human body. The smell of a person or an object\nwill determine our reactions and responses to it. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Women in particular\nhave been found to be most sensitive to smell, especially during the time of\nthe mid-menstrual cycle .&nbsp; This fact has\nled science to discover the connection between the sense of smell and the\nproduction of sex hormones. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>WHEN A MAN SEES\nSHIT\u2014</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>THE FIRST RELEX IS TO SALIVATE \u2013</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">THE SAME RESPONSE WHEN HE SMELLS&nbsp; TASTY FOOD.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to tantra,\nthe sense of smell is connected to mooladhara chakra, the energy centre\nsituated at the base of the spinal column. This centre is the seat of\nman's&nbsp; spiritual energy. In order to\nawaken mooladhara, we therefore utilize the yogic practice of concentration in\nwhich you gaze at the nosetip.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This arouses the sensation of psychic odours,\nand is particularly associated with that of sandalwood. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Different odours\nstimulate different energy centres, and sandalwood is said to activate the\ncentre at the bottom of the spine. It is also the smell of the subtle body.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So\neven though this practice is based on a physiological process, it enables the\nawareness to become more sensitive to subtle vibrations. It can even help bring\nabout the awakening of kundalini, the high-powered generator which illumines\nthe hitherto unexplored areas of the brain responsible for all of man's\ningenuity, higher knowledge and self-realization. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swara yoga says that by\nconcentrating on the pranic flow, one can experience the existence of supreme\nconsciousness.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shiva is consciousness,\nand it manifests as mind. Shakti is energy manifesting as prana, and in swara\nyoga it becomes the tool for understanding consciousness. Just as prana exists\nin cosmic and individual states, so does consciousness.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tantra and yoga define\nmatter as a gross form of energy. Of &nbsp;course,\nthe energy inherent in matter can be liberated, but &nbsp;still it will not be the final product.\nInherent in energy is consciousness.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The difference between these three states\nis only the vibrational rate and density of energy. At the highest &nbsp;and most subtle level of vibration, energy\nmanifests as pure &nbsp;consciousness.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the\nrate of vibration decreases, it appears &nbsp;to\nbe pure energy, and finally it solidifies into matter.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the &nbsp;reverse order, matter can be transformed into\nenergy, and &nbsp;energy into consciousness.\nThe objective of swara yoga is to &nbsp;experience\nthe inherent energy in matter and mind so that consciousness manifests.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One therapeutic goal of\nyoga and pranayama is that it can alleviate some of the chronic negative\neffects of stress.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Deep diaphragmatic breathing,\ncalled ventilation consists of two phases, inspiration and expiration. During\ninspiration the diaphragm and the external intercostal muscles contract. The\ndiaphragm moves downward increasing the volume of the thoracic (chest) cavity,\nand the external intercostal muscles pull the ribs up and outward, expanding\nthe rib cage, further increasing this chest volume.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This increase of volume lowers\nthe air pressure in the lungs as compared to atmospheric air. Because air\nalways flows from a region of high pressure to an area of lower pressure, it\ntravels in through the body\u2019s conducting airway (nostrils, throat, larynx and\ntrachea) into the alveoli of the lungs. During a resting expiration the\ndiaphragm and external intercostal muscles relax, restoring the thoracic cavity\nto its original (smaller) volume, and forcing air out of the lungs into the\natmosphere.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whereas breathing is involved with the movement of air into and out\nof the thoracic cavity, respiration involves the exchange of gases in the\nlungs. With each breath, air passes through it\u2019s conducting zone into the\nmicroscopic air sacs in the lunges called alveoli. It is here that external\n(referring to the lungs) respiration occurs.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is in the alveoli that one of\nthe most important transfers in our entire body takes place. It is here that\nthe respiratory system comes into direct contact with the circulatory system,\nor blood vessels. There are about 600 million alveoli in the lungs, with a\ntotal surface area of about &nbsp;76 square\nmetres ..The large alveolar surface area, combined with the thin membranes,\nallows gases to diffuse easily across the alveolar walls.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The diameter of the\ncapillaries surrounding the alveoli is so small that only one red blood cell\ncan pass through at a time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This slows down the\nblood cells, so that gases have more time to diffuse through the capillaries. Oxygen in the lungs passes through the\nalveoli into the blood.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;External respiration is the exchange of oxygen\nand carbon dioxide between the air and the blood in the lungs. Blood enters the\nlungs via the pulmonary arteries. It then proceeds through arterioles and into\nthe very tiny alveolar capillaries.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oxygen and carbon dioxide are exchanged\nbetween the blood and the air; oxygen is loaded onto the red blood cells while\ncarbon dioxide is unloaded from them into the air. The oxygenated blood then\nflows out of the alveolar capillaries, through venules, and back to the heart\nvia the pulmonary veins. The heart then pumps the blood throughout the systemic\narteries to deliver oxygen throughout the body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The respiratory center\nin the brainstem is responsible for controlling a person\u2019s breathing rate. It\nsends a message to the respiratory muscles telling them when to breathe. The\nmedulla, located nearest the spinal cord, directs the spinal cord to maintain\nbreathing, and the pons, a part of the brain very near the medulla, provides\nfurther smoothing of the respiration pattern.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This control is automatic,\ninvoluntary and continuous. You do not have to consciously think about it. The\nrespiratory center knows how to control the breathing rate and depth by the\namount (or percent) of carbon dioxide, oxygen and acidosis in the arterial\nblood . There are receptors, called chemoreceptors, in the arch of the aorta\nand throughout the arteries that send signals and feedback (to the respiratory\ncenter) to increase or decrease the ventilatory output depending on the\ncondition of these metabolic variables.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, when you exercise, carbon\ndioxide levels increase significantly which alert the chemoreceptors, which\nsubsequently notify the brain\u2019s respiratory center to increase the speed and\ndepth of breathing. This elevated respiration rids the body of excess carbon\ndioxide and supplies the body with more oxygen, which are needed during aerobic\nexercise.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Upon cessation of the exercise, breathing rate and depth gradually\ndeclines until carbon dioxide in the arterial blood returns to normal levels;\nthe respiratory center will no longer be activated, and breathing rate is\nrestored to a pre-exercise pattern. This arterial pressure regulation feedback\nsystem that carbon dioxide, oxygen and blood acid levels provide is referred to\nas the metabolic control of breathing<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Breathing is most\nunique as compared to other visceral (e.g. digestion, endocrine cardiovascular)\nfunctions in that it can also be regulated voluntarily. The behavioral, or\nvoluntary control of breathing is located in the cortex of the brain and\ndescribes that aspect of breathing with conscious control, such as a\nself-initiated change in breathing before a vigorous exertion or effort</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The differentiation\nbetween voluntary and automatic (metabolic) breathing is that automatic\nbreathing requires no attention to maintain, whereas voluntary breathing\ninvolves a given amount of focus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The aim of pranayama\nbreathing appears to shift the autonomic nervous system away from its sympathetic\n(excitatory) dominance. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pranayama breathing has\nbeen shown to positively affect immune function, hypertension, asthma,\nautonomic nervous system imbalances, and psychological or stress-related\ndisorders<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The main philosophy\nbehind the yoga control of breathing is to increase awareness and understanding\nof the relationship between cognitive states, physical functioning, and\nbreathing styles.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Breath awareness was\noriginally developed to the movements being done by the yogi to achieve the\njoining of the mind, body, and spirit in search for self-awareness, health and\nspiritual growth cause<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By becoming aware of\nthe breath and the flow of prana, you attune the mind to more subtle\nvibrations. Swara yoga says first realize the energy potential operating in the\nbody, then realize the potential energy of the mind, and finally realize the\ninherent consciousness in both.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Matter, energy and\nconsciousness are convertible and reconvertible. This is the basic principle of\ntantra and modern science. Physics defines matter as a combination of trillions\nof particles, molecules, atoms and subatoms.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The difference between each mass\nis in the arrangement and vibration of the particles. If you change these\nfactors, the mass also changes form. &nbsp;Yoga\nconsiders pure consciousness to be the basic element that manifests in the\nvarious forms of creation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Particle physics\nexplains how the atoms of every object interconnect with the particles of the\nsurrounding environment. Thus every manifestation in creation forms part of a never-ending\nfield or matrix of particles.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Everything is part of\nan undifferentiated whole, and whatever exists within this field is changed\nonly by the restructuring of the particles.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the continual\nprocess of nature, all these particles interact and vibrate unceasingly. The\nfield is thus in a state of constant motion, and yet as a whole it is not\nmoving anywhere. This is exactly what is explained in the Ishopanishad in\nreference to the nature of consciousness: \"It moves, it moves not. It is\nfar, it is near. It is within all this, and it is outside all this.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Physics talks about the\nundifferentiated field, and yoga about an all-pervading consciousness.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Einstein,\nlifted from Vedas and spAke --\"We may therefore regard matter as being\nconstituted by the regions of space in which the field (consciousness) is extremely\nintense . . . There is no place in this new kind of physics both for the field\n(consciousness) and matter, for the field (consciousness) is the only\nreality.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">VEDAS WAS THE FIRST TO\nMENTION THE WORD CONSCIOUSNESS</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">T he ancient yogis were\nable to define mind and consciousness by becoming receptive to the subtler\nvibrations in the universe. The more sensitive their awareness became, the more\nsubtle vibrations they were able to perceive. In every realm of existence they\nperceived the underlying consciousness.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word consciousness has often been confused\nwith the individual mind, but the individual mind is only the tool of\nconsciousness. That capacity which enables us to be aware is more than mind; it\nis consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ancient Vedic\nrishis in all their wisdom said, that our universe is not woven from&nbsp; matter but consciousness .&nbsp; These seers and channels with 12 strand DNA\nand king sized pineal glands said,&nbsp; that\nthe universal laws are clear, your attitude about your life will shape it.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your\ncurrent thoughts are shaping your future life When you visualise you generate\npowerful thoughts and feelings of having it now.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The law of attraction returns\nthat reality exactly&nbsp; as you saw it in\nyour mind.
