The brain is governed by the laws of quantum\nphysics rather than the laws of biology or neurophysiology<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At our most elemental\nwe are energy. All living things are a coalescence of energy in a field of\nenergy connected to every other thing in the world. This pulsating energy field\nis the central engine of our being and our Consciousness .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Collective\nconsciousness is a life force flowing through the universe. Consciousness of\nthe observer brought the observed object into being. Nothing in the universe\nexisted as an actual thing independently of our perception of it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All orderliness that we\nfind exhibited in all levels of nature - from the smallest atom, through the\nliving organisms, to the largest cluster of galaxies - is the expression of the\ninfinite orderliness that is contained in consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Quantum coherence in\nthe micro tubules of every cell is the key to consciousness .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Our brain is\nholographic.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">While introducing Nikola Tesla to Akasha or longitudinal field ZPF\nwaves , in 1903, &nbsp;Vivekananda told him&nbsp; - \"Every part is a whole and everything springs from the whole\". <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">This was 45 years\nbefore a hologram was invented.</span>&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/0Pn5oo24THM/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/0Pn5oo24THM?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Om Purnamadah\nPurnamidam Purnat Purnamudachyate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Purnasya Purnamadaya\nPurnamevavashisyate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">From infinity is born\ninfinity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When infinity is taken\nout of infinity,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Only infinity is left\nover.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Om, the BrahmAn is\ninfinite, whole and complete,</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our brain can store\nunlimited data, because our brain is holographic.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Holograms\nare all about changing the angle at which two lasers strike a piece of\nphotographic film- to record many different images on same surface.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Any\nimage thus recorded can be retrieved simply by illuminating the film with a\nlaser beam possessing the same angle as the original two beams.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our FREE CHOICE is\nabout finding the right angle to call up the image / memory of what we want or\nsearch. This is why a person seconds away from suicide can be given a tight\nslap across his face , to force change this angle-- and then he would not want\nto commit suicide at all.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Rig Veda\nthe knowledge of the \"soul,\" or the Self of all beings is the\nprerequisite to the understanding of anything else. The Upanishads say: \"Know\nthat, by which everything is known\u201d.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once we have a glimpse of the omnipresent\nnature of our consciousness, once we have a glimpse of a field of existence\nthat is indeed the omnipresent source of all that exists, we naturally start to\nbe aware of the interconnectedness of all levels of creation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once we have seen\nthe whole, we start to recognize the parts as expressions of the whole. Since\nthe whole is holistic in its nature, its expressions are holistic\nrepresentations of the whole.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of the twelve major\nmeridians of acupuncture, six (stomach, bladder, gallbladder, large intestine,\nsmall intestine and triple heater) have either their points of entry or of exit\nin the area of trigeminal nerve innervation which surrounds the nasal mucus\nmembrane.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The trigeminal nerve is the largest and most complex of the 12\ncranial nerves (CNs). It supplies sensations to the face, mucous membranes, and\nother structures of the head. It is the motor nerve for the muscles of\nmastication and contains proprioceptive fibers.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nasal concha , also called a\nturbinate , is a long, narrow, curled shelf of bone that protrudes into the\nbreathing passage of the nose.. In humans, the turbinates divide the nasal\nairway into 4 groove-like air passages, and are responsible for forcing inhaled\nair to flow in a steady, regular pattern around the largest possible surface\narea of nasal mucosa, which, as a ciliated mucous membrane with shallow blood\nsupply, cleans and warms the inhaled air in preparation for the lungs.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A rapidly\ndilating arteriolar circulation to these bones may lead to a sharp increase in\nthe pressure within, in response to acute cooling of the body core. The pain\nfrom this pressure is often referred to as \"brain freeze\"..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The shallowness of the\nvenous blood supply of the mucosa contributes to the ease with which nosebleed\ncan occur. The turbinates comprise most of the mucosal tissue of the nose and\nare required for functional respiration.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The turbinates are enriched with\nairflow pressure and temperature-sensing nerve receptors (linked to the\n\"trigeminal\" nerve route, the fifth cranial nerve), allowing for\ntremendous erectile capabilities of nasal congestion and decongestion, in\nresponse to the weather conditions and changing needs of the body..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In addition,\nthe erectile tissue undergoes an often unnoticed cycle of partial congestion\nand decongestion called the nasal cycle. The flow of blood to the nasal mucosa,\nin particular the venous plexus of the conchae is regulated by the\npterygopalatine ganglion and heats or cools the air in the nose.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nnasopulmonary and nasothoracic reflexes regulate the mechanism of breathing\nthrough deepening the inhale. Triggered by the flow of the air, the pressure of\nthe air in the nose, and the quality of the air, impulses from the nasal mucosa\nare transmitted by the trigeminal nerve to the breathing centres in the\nbrainstem, and the generated response is transmitted to the bronchi, the\nintercostal muscles, and the diaphragm.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The turbinates provide, first and\nforemost, the humidity needed to preserve the delicate olfactory epithelium,\nwhich in turn is needed to keep the olfactory receptors healthy and alert. If\nthe epithelial layer gets dry ( due to inability to shift the dominant nostril\n)&nbsp; , it may cease to function&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The entire\nmucosa is highly concentrated with blood vessels and contains large venous-like\nspaces; bodies which have a vein-like appearance and swell and congest in\nresponse to allergy or infection. Unlike other nasal mucosa, the epithelium of\nthe olfactory system does not project cilia. This mucosa contains nerves which\nconnect to the olfactory nerve.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The conchae (turbinate bones) of the nasal\nmucosa expand the total surface area of the mucosa and create turbulence in air\nentering the respiratory passage. This causes air to swirl as it moves through\nthe nasal cavity and increases contact between infiltrating air and the nasal\nmucosa, allowing particles in the air to be trapped before entering other parts\nof the respiratory system (e.g. the lungs).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Eithelial cells&nbsp; regulate immune responses which occur if the\nphysical barrier fails and pathogens infiltrate cells of the nasal mucosa.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Allergens can directly\nactivate the epithelial cells to produce an inflammatory response Endothelial\ncells are cells which line the walls of the arteries that feed the nasal\nmucosa. They are also involved in allergic responses.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cilia or small hairs\nwhich project from the epithelium and line the nasal mucosa create motions\nwhich drain mucus from the nasal passage to the throat from where it is swallowed\nand digested by stomach juices.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The activity level of cilia is dependent on\ntemperature and in cold temperatures cilia become less active. The thin walled\nveins on which the nasal mucosa rests function to warm air entering the\nrespiratory passage. Due to the high concentration of blood vessels in the\nnasal cavity, changes in these blood vessels contribute to nasal congestion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The different types of\nnerves found in the nasal cavity and mucosa have various functions. For\nexample, constriction of blood vessels which feed the nasal cavity is regulated\nin part by the sympathetic nervous system, while the parasympathetic nervous\nsystem plays a role in regulating secretions of mucus from nasal glands.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other\nnerves in the nasal cavity influence the dilation of blood vessels, nasal\nsecretions, inflammation and interactions between nerves and the mast cells\nwhich mediate allergic responses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The nasal cavity has a\nvery rich blood supply arising from both the internal and external carotid\narteries. The nose is&nbsp; richly supplied by\nspecial nerves from the autonomic nervous system. The autonomic nervous system\ncontrols many involuntary functions in the body (blood pressure, heart rate,\nbreathing) via \u201csympathetic\u201d and \u201cparasympathetic\u201d nerve fibers.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the nose,\nthe autonomic nerves control the air-conditioning action, nasal resistance,\nmucus secretion and the function of the cilia and mucus blanket.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nasal\nsecretions and mucus gland production are controlled by \u201cparasympathetic\u201d\ninnervation, which is carried to the nasal cavity via the greater superficial\npetrosal nerve. This nerve ultimately becomes the vidian nerve, which sends\nparasympathetic nerve fibers along with branches of the sphenopalatine nerve&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blood flow to the nasal cavity and nasal mucosa is controlled largely by\nsympathetic innervation, fibers of which also travel along with the\nsphenopalatine nerve. Changes in sympathetic stimulation result in a rhythmic\nswelling of nasal blood vessels and a corresponding increase in nasal airway\nresistance (nasal cycle)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-dqUpTm8StzE/Wn1YIhZHynI/AAAAAAABYc4/8pK-y4Qb0bsuddfSFvBXMECnwCI6IdgWACLcBGAs/s1600/20t5299.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"289\" data-original-width=\"401\" height=\"460\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-dqUpTm8StzE/Wn1YIhZHynI/AAAAAAABYc4/8pK-y4Qb0bsuddfSFvBXMECnwCI6IdgWACLcBGAs/s640/20t5299.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ryGPMiSNtzE/Wn1Y3d4E8aI/AAAAAAABYdA/_sdTExM_yM8VaHUzCZDia1jPjQw_GcH9QCLcBGAs/s1600/sleide_2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"720\" data-original-width=\"960\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ryGPMiSNtzE/Wn1Y3d4E8aI/AAAAAAABYdA/_sdTExM_yM8VaHUzCZDia1jPjQw_GcH9QCLcBGAs/s640/sleide_2.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-QYm4FIWv4YY/Wn1aCGfegPI/AAAAAAABYdM/I0ACfptlbho1c7BhwK6PhniHdXuHQ4x5QCLcBGAs/s1600/c33912b87e03c167ed3429bd033f4a535cd3442d1.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"950\" data-original-width=\"1600\" height=\"380\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-QYm4FIWv4YY/Wn1aCGfegPI/AAAAAAABYdM/I0ACfptlbho1c7BhwK6PhniHdXuHQ4x5QCLcBGAs/s640/c33912b87e03c167ed3429bd033f4a535cd3442d1.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern research and\nclinical studies have verified the efficacy of the practices of swara yoga. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Scientists have long\nknown that two eyes are absolutely necessary for stereoscopic, three\ndimensional vision.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Similarly, two ears are needed to precisely locate the\nsource and direction of sounds, and two vestibular organs are necessary to give\nan adequate sense of position and balance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This false conclusion\ncan be understood when we consider that the breath flows as two separate\ncolumns for only the length of the nostrils (4 cms), before mixing together in\nthe nasopharynx at the back of the nasal cavity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It then flows as a single column\nof air down the trachea and larynx towards the lungs. In this light, the\nindividual flow for a few inches along each nostril does not seem, on the\nsurface, to be important.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The question of why man\npossesses two nostrils seems to have never been considered serious enough to\nwarrant further scientific&nbsp;\ninvestigation\u2014though it was expounded in Vedas 7000 years ago.</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The nasopharynx\nconnects the nose to the rest of the pharynx. &nbsp;It allows air to flow from the nose and\nthrough the oropharynx, hypopharynx and larynx. Air then flows into the lungs\nthrough the trachea.</span> <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pharyngeal plexus\nis a network of nerve fibers innervating most of the palate and pharynx. Intrinsic\nmuscles of the larynx are innervated by the vagus nerve -- not by the\npharyngeal plexus. Instead, they are innervated by the recurrent laryngeal\nnerve and the external branch of the superior laryngeal nerve, branches of the\nvagus.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\">Yoga dabbled with the Vagus\nnerve-- the longest nerve of the autonomic nervous system in the human body.&nbsp; Vagus nerve transmits GUT instincts to the brain.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\">This nerve an amygdala is mentioned in Susruta Samhita\n6200 years &nbsp;ago. </span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">Below:&nbsp; &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;helvetica&quot; , &quot;dejavu sans&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 16px;\">90% of the nerve fibers in the vagus nerve are dedicated to communicating the state of your viscera up to your brain.&nbsp; Cutting</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;helvetica&quot; , &quot;dejavu sans&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 16px;\">&nbsp;the vagus nerve turns the usual feedback loop between gut instincts and the brain from a two-way communication into a one-way street.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;helvetica&quot; , &quot;dejavu sans&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 16px;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;helvetica&quot; , &quot;dejavu sans&quot; , sans-serif;\">Yoga is NOT savage superstition.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;helvetica&quot; , &quot;dejavu sans&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 16px;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;helvetica&quot; , &quot;dejavu sans&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 16px;\">Healthy vagus nerve communication between your gut and your brain helps to slow you down like the brakes on your car by using neurotransmitters such as acetylcholine and GABA. These neurotransmitters literally lower heart rate, blood pressure, and help your heart and organs slow down so that you can rest-and-digest.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;helvetica&quot; , &quot;dejavu sans&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 16px;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-qdGxp8dpNjQ/Wn1gmKGL2sI/AAAAAAABYdc/AHHHpz8gZfIVzfButEk3VEQ-Wjlo1pRIgCLcBGAs/s1600/VWagus%2BNerve.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"698\" data-original-width=\"459\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-qdGxp8dpNjQ/Wn1gmKGL2sI/AAAAAAABYdc/AHHHpz8gZfIVzfButEk3VEQ-Wjlo1pRIgCLcBGAs/s1600/VWagus%2BNerve.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The vagus nerve has a\nsympathetic function .</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The vagus nerve supplies motor\nparasympathetic fibres to all the organs (except the adrenal glands), from the\nneck down to the second segment of the transverse colon.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nvagus nerve also plays a role in satiation following food consumption. Knocking\nout vagal nerve receptors &nbsp;causes\nhyperphagia (greatly increased food intake).</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vagal and spinal\nganglionic nerves mediate the lowering of the heart rate.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Excessive\nactivation of the vagal nerve during emotional stress, which is a\nparasympathetic overcompensation of a strong sympathetic nervous system\nresponse associated with stress, can also cause vasovagal syncope due to a\nsudden drop in cardiac output, causing cerebral hypoperfusion.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vasovagal\nsyncope affects young children and women more than other groups. It can also\nlead to temporary loss of bladder control under moments of extreme fear.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vagus\nnerve stimulation (VNS) therapy using a neurostimulator implanted in the chest\nis a treatment used to control seizures in epilepsy patients and has been\napproved for treating drug-resistant cases of clinical depression.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern research and\nclinical studies have verified the efficacy of the practices of swara yoga. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Scientists have long\nknown that two eyes are absolutely necessary for stereoscopic, three\ndimensional vision. Similarly, two ears are needed to precisely locate the\nsource and direction of sounds, and two vestibular organs are necessary to give\nan adequate sense of position and balance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This false conclusion\ncan be understood when we consider that the breath flows as two separate\ncolumns for only the length of the nostrils (4 cms), before mixing together in\nthe nasopharynx at the back of the nasal cavity. It then flows as a single column\nof air down the trachea and larynx towards the lungs. In this light, the\nindividual flow for a few inches along each nostril does not seem, on the\nsurface, to be important.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The question of why man\npossesses two nostrils seems to have never been considered serious enough to\nwarrant further scientific&nbsp;\ninvestigation\u2014though it was expounded in Vedas 7000 years ago.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The nasopharynx is the\nspace above the soft palate at the back of the nose and connects the nose to\nthe mouth, which allows a person to breathe through the nose. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern studies on\nnostril domination is incomplete--it will take them another 200 years&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patients whose breath\nflowed predominantly via the left nostril (89% of cases), suffered a higher\nthan average incidence of a wide variety of respiratory disorders, including\nchronic muco-purulent sinusitis, middle and inner ear infections, partial or\ntotal loss of senses of smell, hearing and taste, recurrent pharyngitis,\nlaryngitis and tonsillitis, chronic bronchitis and bronchiectasis. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sufferers from this\nsyndrome were more likely to suffer from one or more of a wide variety of more\ndistant disorders, including amnesia, intellectual weakness, headaches,\nhyperthyroidism (with associated irritability), cardiopulmonary weakness\n(manifesting in palpitations, asthma-like attacks and chronic heart failure),\ninsufficiency of liver and gallbladder (with varied symptoms), persistently\naltered cellular constituents of the blood and lymphatic fluid, chronic\ngastritis and enterocolitis (with symptoms of heartburn, gastric reflux, peptic\nulcer and constipation), and sexual and reproductive disorders (symptoms of\ndiminution of libido, ovarian irregularities and diminished virility).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patients whose breath\nflowed predominantly through the right nostril,&nbsp;\nwere found to be predisposed to arterial hypertension and its numerous\nconsequences.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is now confirmed\nthat the state of general physical and mental health has a definite relation to\nthe patency of the nasal passages and their sensitive lining of mucus membrane.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Scientists surgically\nremoved the folds of nasal mucus membrane from 40 NON-CONSCIOUS ( whocannot\npass color / mirror tests )&nbsp; different\nanimal species, including hares, dogs and guinea pigs, and found that it\nresulted in the cessation of sexual maturation in young animals..&nbsp; By crushing the extracts of mucus membranes and\nadministering it to female guinea pigs, muscular activity of the uterus was\ninduced.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to yogic\nphysiology and philosophy, three main nadis exist within the frame of the\nspinal column - ida, pingala and sushumna. Ida and pingala are responsible for\nthe two sides of human nature coexisting within every individual. Ida is the\nintroverted, mental side of our personality and represents the lunar,\nsubjective and receptive aspect of our being.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the flow of prana in ida\nnadi is predominant, mentality predominates over vitality, and the jnanendriyas\n(organs of outer knowledge or sensory input, the eyes, ears, nose, tongue and\nskin) are activated. Pingala nadi corresponds to the extroverted, expressive\nside of the personality, and represents our solar, dynamic and objective\naspect.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the prana flows predominantly in pingala nadi, vitality\npredominates over mentality, and the karmendriyas (motor organs or organs of\naction, the hands, feet, sexual organs, anus and vocal cords) are activated.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Symbolically, ida can be understood as the receptive, feminine side of our\nbeing and pingala as its masculine, expressive counterpart.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swara yoga concerns the\nrealisation of man's essential nature as the balance between these dual and\ncomplementary polarities. The third nadi is sushumna and prana is induced to\nflow in this nadi only when ida and pingala, the mental and vital sides of the\npersonality, are functioning in perfect balance.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This can only occur when an\nequal volume of breath is moving in and out of each nostril. At that time, the\nawareness is neither introverted nor extroverted, but remains balanced between\nthe two. This is when sushumna nadi flows and the state of meditation (dhyana)\ndawns effortlessly.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The right hemisphere\nhas been found to assume responsibility for the holistic, intuitional and\npsychic side of our perception which are ida nadi functions, while the left\nhemisphere has been found responsible for our logical, rational and analytic\nfaculties and sequential and linear modes of thought - all pingala nadi\nfunctions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Further, the left sensory and motor cortex regions of the brain are\nknown to be responsible for the movement and sensation of the right side of the\nbody, while the right cortex assumes responsibility for the left side of the\nbody. This reciprocal innervation occurs via the ascending sensory and\ndescending motor nerve tracts, which cross over to the right side of the\nmidline within the brainstem and spinal cord.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In terms of swara yoga,\ntherefore, the right side of the brain is activated when the left nostril is\nflowing; the left brain is activated when the right nostril flows, and whenever\nboth nostrils flow equally, every faculty of the human brain is functioning in\nan optimal and integrated manner as sushumna nadi awakens. Then meditation is\ndirectly experienced.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The nostril which makes\nthe highest pitch sound is the one that is most constricted. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swara yogis were\nmasters&nbsp; of pranic body rhythms and\nexplores how prana can be controlled through the breath.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swara Yoga is a closely\nguarded science, taught only through direct transmission from guru to disciple,\nvery little has ever been written about it. This is because this science can be\nmisused.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swara yoga emphasizes\nthe analysis of the breath and the significance of different pranic&nbsp; rhythms, whereas pranayama involves\ntechniques to redirect, store and control prana. Swara yoga may therefore be\nsaid to involve the practices of pranayama, but in fact it is a much more\nextensive and precise science.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Energy is familiar to\nus in many ways such as light, heat, kinetic and potential, electric and\nmagnetic energy. In the same way sound is also a form of energy The sound\nhaving frequency below 20 Hz are called Infrasonic while those having\nfrequencies above 20,000 Hz are called Ultrasonic. Ultrasonic waves are very\nuseful in scientific laboratories, diagnostic instruments and ultrasonic\nmachines.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sound is propagated through a material medium as a wave.&nbsp; The longitudinal sound wave moves as a\npressure wave in the air - compressing and than rarefying the air.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a wave\nis propagated in a medium, each particle in the medium vibrates simple\nharmonically about its mean position. The energy of vibration is imparted to\nthe succeeding particles, which also starts vibrating. Thus energy is\ntransformed from one particle to another.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is termed as wave\nmotion A sound wave, on the other hand, is a longitudinal wave. As the energy\nofwave motion is propagated outward from the center ofdisturbance, the\nindividual air molecules that carry the sound move back and forth, parallel to\nthe direction ofwave motion.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus, a sound wave is a series of alternate\nincreases and decreases of air pressure. Each individual molecule passes the\nenergy on to neighboring molecules, but after the sound wave has passed, each\nmolecule remains in about the same location</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Two traveling waves which exist in\nthe same medium will interfere with each other. If their amplitudes add, the\ninterference is said to be constructive interference, and destructive\ninterference ifthey are \"out of phase\" and subtract.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Interference of\nincident and reflected waves is essential to the production ofresonant standing\nwaves.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Interference has far\nreaching consequences in sound because ofthe production of \"beats\"\nbetween two frequencies which interfere with each other<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is the Swara that\nhas given form to the first accumulations of the divisions of the universe; the\nSwara causes involution and evolution; the Swara is God Himself<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Divisions of Time ~<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I shall begin with a\nTruti as the least division of time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">26-2/3 truti = 1\nnimesha = 8/45 second.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">18 nimesha = 1 kashtha\n= 3-1/5 seconds = 8 vipala.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">30 kashtha = 1 kala =\n1-3/5 minutes = 4 pala.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">30 kala = 1 mahurta =\n48 minutes = 2 ghari.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">30 mahurta = 1 day and\nnight = 24 hours = 60 ghari.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">30 days and nights and odd\nhours = 1 Pitruja day and night = 1 month and odd hours.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">12 months = 1 Daiva day\nand night = 1 year = 365 days, 15\u201d, 30\u201d, 31\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">365 Daiva days and\nnights = 1 Daiva year.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4,800 Daiva years = 1\nSatya yuga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3,600 Daiva years = 1\nTreta yuga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2,400 Daiva years = 1\nDwapara yuga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1,200 Daiva years = 1\nKali yuga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">12,000 Daiva years = 1\nChaturyugi (four yuga).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">12,000 Chaturyugi = 1\nDaiva yuga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2,000 Daiva yuga = 1\nday and night of Brahma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">365 Brahmic days and\nnights = 1 year of Brahma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">71 Daiva yuga = 1\nManwantara.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">12,000 Brahmic years =\n1 Chaturyuga of Brahma, and so one.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">200 yuga of Brahma = 1\nday and night of parabrahma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These days and nights\nfollow each other in eternal succession, and hence eternal evolution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">and involution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/07/oort-cloud-hindu-yugas-and-breath-of.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/07/oort-cloud-hindu-yugas-and-breath-of.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If Prana recedes from\nany part of the body (for some reason or other), that part loses its<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">power of action. This\nis local death. It is in this way that we become deaf, dumb, blind, etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the act of breathing,\ncosmic energies are drawn into the body. Thus the breath becomes the\nintermediate link between man and the universe, between the gross and subtle\nrealms of existence.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tantra teaches us that whatever exists in the macrocosm\nexists in the microcosm. So, the individual body is but a replica of the cosmic\nbody, the breath being the mediator of the two.</span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_194BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_194b+seedBNVwD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8939608705875601053\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_194M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/08365590956295754270\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Razor Skidrow</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/02/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_7.html?showComment=1518179322991#c8939608705875601053\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 9, 2018 at 5:58 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_194MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCapt. Ajit Vadakayil, India will reallly shine one day as per your wishes</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_194BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; This wont work.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Because of the potency of the Chinese drugs they go to USA from other nations through the postal system, exploiting the sheer volume of international mail and sending smaller packages.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Carfentanil can arrive in very small mail packets . A unit of carfentanil is 100 times as potent as the same amount of fentanyl, 5,000 times as potent as a unit of heroin and 10,000 times as potent as a unit of morphine.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">In the last two years 2.1 lakh Americans have died due to Fentanyl overdose.</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">An effective was to stop this would be to de-criminalise non-addictive marijuana . Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/02/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_9.html?showComment=1518280658793#c8154428652825087249\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 10, 2018 at 10:07 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_97MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://cointelegraph.com/news/is-darknet-done-with-bitcoin<br />\n<br />\nThe internet is vast, yet an enormous chunk of it is still untouched by the ordinary world. We address that part by the names Deep Web, Darknet, and Dark Web. Darknet is a type of network not accessible using normal modes.<br />\n<br />\nDeep Web \u2013 which includes dark web as a subset \u2013 is the part of the world wide web not indexed by the search engines like Google, Bing, Yahoo etc<br />\n<br />\nThe world wide web we see is only the tip of an iceberg. Two terms Darknet and Deep Web, in some sense, justify the presence of this hidden web about which most people are unaware.<br />\n<br />\nContrary to deep web, Darknet is better known to the people. It is an encrypted network built on top of the existing internet, and specific software or tools are required to access the darknet. Conventional protocols used on the internet might not work on the darknet.<br />\n<br />\nDarknet provides anonymity to the users. One such darknet is Tor or The Onion Router. You require the Tor browser to enter into the Tor\u2019s network.<br />\n<br />\nThe darknet is a network, and the deep web constitutes the chunk of the World Wide Web that is beyond the reach of the search engines. So, we can decipher dark web as the World Wide Web of the darknets like Tor, Freenet, etc. That is, the services and websites running on the darknet is the dark web.<br />\n<br />\nNOW COMES THE BAD NEWS<br />\n<br />\nALL THOSE WHO BOUGHT DRUGS , CHILD SEX , ARMS AND MERCENARY SERVICES ON DARKNET USING BITCOIN -- ARE PROFILED BY NSA !<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c552649048507130130\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_119M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. THE RIVER PILOT TOLD ME THAT HIS ASSISTANT PILOT WAS FROM CORNELL.... HE CALLED THE GUY IN FROM THE BRIDGE WINGS, A HUGE FELLOW...<br />\n<br />\nHE SAID HE WAS DOING \"GOVT STUDIES \" IN CORNELL.. HARDLY ATTENDED CLASS.. WHOLE DAY HE WAS IN THE FIELD PRACTICING AMERICAN FOOTBALL.... HE SAID , YOU SON WAS IN COMPUTER SCIENCE SECTION--HE WONT EVEN HAVE TIME TO SEE OUR FINAL MATCH ...<br />\n<br />\nWHAT HE SAID IS TRUE ..<br />\n<br />\nMY SON HAD RENTED AN EXPENSIVE CONDOMINIUM RIGHT OUTSIDE CORNELL GATES WITH GRAND PIANO .. YET HE SLEPT INSIDE THE COLLEGE LAB SEVERAL NIGHTS..<br />\n<br />\nCORNELL WAS A SWEATSHOP FOR COMPUTER STUDENTS..<br />\n<br />\nSAME WAY WINKLEVOSS TWINS WOULD BE ROWING THE WHOLE DAY INSTEAD OF BEING IN CLASS ... THEY ( CAMERON / TYLER WINKLEVOSS ) REPRESENTED USA IN OLYMPICS...<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/my-son-at-cornell-university-capt-ajit_25.html<br />\n<br />\nFACE BOOK NOW HAS AN AD RUNNING-- SOCIAL ENGINEERING TO CORRUPT INDIAN WOMEN..<br />\n<br />\nA DR NEHA THOMAS ( FROM KERALA ) IS A DOCTOR DURING DAY AND AT NIGHT SHE PARTIES HARD --.. AND GOES BACK HOME AT DAWN ... SHE SAYS SHE DOES NOT WANT ANY RELATIONSHIP..<br />\n<br />\nONE FINE DAY NEHA THOMAS BABY WILL MARRY AN INNOCENT MAN...<br />\n<br />\nHER WEDDING NIGHT GIFT FOR HER UNSUSPECTING HUSBAND ?<br />\n<br />\nA SLACK TWAT WHICH CAN ACCOMODATE A FOOTBALL ...AND AN ASSHOLE WHICH CAN ACCOMODATE A TENNIS BALL...<br />\n<br />\nNCW SPONSORS SUCH BRAVEHEART ICONS...THEY ENCOURAGE INDIAN WOMEN TO LOSE THEIR VIRGINITY BEFORE MARRIAGE ...<br />\n<br />\nI KNOW OF SUCH A KERALA FEMALE DOCTOR ( STANLEY MEDICAL COLLEGE ) IN REAL LIFE...<br />\n<br />\nSHE DATED OUR SARDAR CHIEF OFFICER....SHE WOULD SLEEP OVER ON THE SHIP WHILE THE SHIP WAS IN CHENNAI.. CHIEF OFFICER WOULD ORDER ME TO OPEN THE PUMP BYPASS VALVES SO THAT WE REMAIN MORE TIME IN PORT ( 90,000 TONNES OF CRUDE OIL ) ...<br />\n<br />\nI USED TO DROP HER BACK TO HOSPITAL BEFORE THE SHIP SAILED..CHIEF OFFICER TRUSTED ME ..<br />\n<br />\nONE DAY IN FRONT OF ME THE ELECTRICAL OFFICER ( A MALAYALI ) ASKED HER IN THE BOAT ON RIDE FROM BHARATI DOCK --\"ARE YOU A GOOD GIRL ?\" --AND SHE CRIED...<br />\n<br />\nSARDAR CHIEF OFFICER USED TO ABDICATE WHEN HE HAD HER --FINAL YEAR MEDICAL STUDENT, VERY ATTRACTIVE , A HINDU GIRL FROM GURUVAYUR -- IN THE BEDROOM ( YEAR 1975 I WAS THIRD OFFICER ) ...<br />\n<br />\nHE WOULD TELL ME \" AJIT, DONT DISTURB ME EVEN IF SHIP CATCHES FIRE--YOU HANDLE IT\"<br />\n<br />\nDO WE HAVE NCW TO PROTECT WOMEN OR LEAD THEM TO PSYCHOLOGICAL RUIN..<br />\n<br />\nWHY DOES NCW ENCOURAGE UNMARRIED GIRLS TO SHOW THEIR PRIVATE PARTS ON THE STREET , HAVE MULTIPLE SEX PARTNERS AND DRINK LIQUOR ?<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_119BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc;
