, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you breathe without\nawareness, the breath is registered in the posterior brain, but when you are\naware that you are breathing and you are consciously witnessing the whole\nprocess, then it is registered by the conscious brain, the frontal brain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prana energy nourishes\nyour brain as it supervises the workings of your nervous system.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ancient yoga\ntexts state that the symptoms of any illness are the manifestation of a\ndecreased flow of prana to particular parts of the body, usually due to lack of\n&nbsp;deep diaphragmatic breathing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By breathing with\nconcerted awareness, a yogi can extract more prana (life-energy) and\ndeliberately direct it wherever it is required, whenever it is needed<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You may not be aware of\nit, but you receive and breathe prana energy all the time\u2014from the food you\neat, the water you drink, from sunlight and the air you breathe, and from the\npeople around you.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With deep diaphragmatic\nbreathing, you can reverse stress symptoms instantly and create a sense of calm\nin your mind and body.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When\nyou breathe deeply and slowly, you activate the parasympathetic nervous system,\nwhich reverses the stress response in your body.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Deep breathing stimulates the\nmain nerve in the parasympathetic nervous system\u2014the vagus nerve\u2014slowing down\nyour heart rate, lowering your blood pressure, and calming your body and mind.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In addition, with deep\nbreathing, you engage the abdominal muscles and diaphragm instead of the\nmuscles in the upper chest and neck. This conditioning of the respiratory\nmuscles results in improved efficiency of oxygen exchange with every breath by\nallowing more air exchange to occur in the lower lungs.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It also reduces strain\non the muscles of the neck and upper chest, allowing these muscles to relax. In\nshort, deep breathing is more relaxing and efficient, allowing higher volumes\nof oxygen to reach the body\u2019s cells and tissues.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The moment you become\naware of your breathing and you begin to conduct and control the breath in a\nparticular fashion, immediately the frontal brain registers the influence.\nConscious breathing has an entirely different effect on the brain than\nunconscious breathing. Through unconscious breathing we are able to feed the\nwhole body with prana, but we cannot supply the brain with sufficient prana for\nits evolution and growth.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-3NubqqQQaNQ/WnaPbJr89vI/AAAAAAABYYA/vJhyZVxJbm0B4RYeue_FAC1kkiwlix5IgCLcBGAs/s1600/3_banrdhas.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"340\" data-original-width=\"720\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-3NubqqQQaNQ/WnaPbJr89vI/AAAAAAABYYA/vJhyZVxJbm0B4RYeue_FAC1kkiwlix5IgCLcBGAs/s1600/3_banrdhas.png\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you practise\npranayama, the pranas are stimulated in the lower region of the body, but you\nmust have a means of forcing the pranic energy up. Somehow, you have to create\na negative force which will push the pranic energy up through the spinal cord.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For this reason pranayama should be practised in coordination with specific\nbandhas.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The three bandhas which are incorporated into the practice of\npranayama are jalandhara bandha, uddiyana bandha and moola bandha. They create\na negative force like the ejecting force used to extract water from a well.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are two forces used for pumping water- the sucking force and the ejecting\nforce. When we practise pranayama with the bandhas, we put an ejecting force\ninto action.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-JxbaPy-NyQU/WnaQgghI0eI/AAAAAAABYYQ/mJEqpBDiWGU_H-HV4Asn6SGDM4-x-un7gCLcBGAs/s1600/Jalanrdhara.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"441\" data-original-width=\"584\" height=\"481\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-JxbaPy-NyQU/WnaQgghI0eI/AAAAAAABYYQ/mJEqpBDiWGU_H-HV4Asn6SGDM4-x-un7gCLcBGAs/s640/Jalanrdhara.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So, through pranayama\nyou generate prana in the lower region of the body, then in order to conduct it\nup to the brain you must first practise moola bandha, then uddiyana bandha and\nfinally jalandhara bandha.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-FzEvsRNE0rY/WnaQuCpT6dI/AAAAAAABYYU/NkRG4dFA2f4vVWvhpw8TcbHkSQxHuYdGACLcBGAs/s1600/pictture-10.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"381\" data-original-width=\"571\" height=\"426\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-FzEvsRNE0rY/WnaQuCpT6dI/AAAAAAABYYU/NkRG4dFA2f4vVWvhpw8TcbHkSQxHuYdGACLcBGAs/s640/pictture-10.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Moola bandha is contraction of the perineum,\nuddiyana bandha is contraction of the abdominal muscles and jalandhara bandha\nis the locking of the chin against the sternum. Prana is then conducted to the\nbrain with the help of the subtle circulatory system.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-TnCl96icATg/WnaQZRXmWpI/AAAAAAABYYM/OVjaUmFtEMQUOC32kA8uHCMJN0WCWZNkwCLcBGAs/s1600/mula-dbandha-1024x624.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"624\" data-original-width=\"1024\" height=\"388\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-TnCl96icATg/WnaQZRXmWpI/AAAAAAABYYM/OVjaUmFtEMQUOC32kA8uHCMJN0WCWZNkwCLcBGAs/s640/mula-dbandha-1024x624.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bandhas function as\nenergy locks to direct prana/energy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/O8TPaUUIbws/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/O8TPaUUIbws?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The true meaning of\nbandha is essentially paradoxical, for it is said that by locking or\ncontracting certain muscles on the physical level a subtle process of\n\u2018unlocking\u2019 goes on simultaneously on physical, mental and pranic levels and\nwithin the psychic and causal bodies.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Contracting or squeezing of muscles\ngroups form three main groups: perineal muscles, abdominal muscles and cervical\nmuscles. Contraction of these specific muscles affects the nervous,\ncirculatory, respiratory, endocrine and energy systems.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bandha may also be\ndefined analogously and is likened to the \u2018damning of a river\u2019 or \u2018building a\nbridge\u2019 <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In yogic language,\nthese granthis prevent the flow of prana into the main pranic passage of the\nbody \u2013 sushumna. When they are released, prana immediately begins to flow\nthrough sushumna nadi, whcich leads to increased receptivity of the mind and in\nturn higher experiences.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Remember, these\nso-called knots are in the psychic body, not in the physical body, but physical\nmanipulations such as bandhas can unlock them. &nbsp;&nbsp;Each level of manifestation has repercussions\non other levels. It is not realistic to rigidly separate the physical body,\npranic body and the mind body. They are all interrelated and really part of a\nwhole. They are only divided or categorized for convenience of explanation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Therefore, the physical\nbody influences the mind and the pranic body. The pranic body influences the\nmind and physical body. And the mind influences the pranic and physical body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bandhas, like all other\nyogic practices, act on and influence different levels of individual being.\nThey have profound effects on the physical, pranic and mental levels.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word bandha means\n\u2018to hold, \u2018tighten\u2019 or \u2018lock\u2019, and this exactly describes the physical action\nnecessary to perform these practices. Specific parts of the body are gently yet\npowerfully contracted and tightened. This has vast repercussions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">First of all\nvarious parts of the physical body are controlled. Organs, muscles, nerves and\nphysical processes within the body are massaged, stimulated and brought under the\nwill of the practitioner.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The physical contaction or lock in turn has an\nextensive influence on the psychic body (pranic body). The flow of prana that\ncontinuously streams through our subtle body is redirected and even stopped.\nThis has direct influences on the mind.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The whole body and mind is\ntranquillized and made receptive to higher states of awareness. Such is the\npower of bandhas when they are perfected.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">1. Moola bandha </b>:&nbsp; &nbsp;perineal contraction, stimulates both the sensory-motor and autonomic nervous\nsystem in the pelvic region, this pelvic stimulation activates the\nparasympathetic fibres emerging from the pelvic spinal cord. Parasympathetic\nfibres emerge from the cervical (neck) and sacral (pelvic) areas only, while sympathetic\nfibres emerge from the thoracic (upper back) and lumbar (lower back) areas.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sanskrit word moola\nmeans \u2018root\u2019 and the word bandha means \u2018lock\u2019. Here the word moola means\nvarious things, it refers to the mooladhara chakra, the seat of the kundalini\nand it also refers to the root of the soine or the trunk of the body, the\nperineum. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Moola bandha can be\ntranslated &nbsp;as \u2018the perineum contraction\nlock\u2019.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the fullest\ndescriptions is given in the hatha yoga pradipika chapter 4: \u201cPress the heels\nagainst the perineum and contract firmly. Draw the apana upwards. This is known\nas moola bandha.\u201d Here, the word apana refers to the function of the body, at\nall levels, gross and subtle, which expels energy and waste material from the\nbody. In the context of pranayama, apana refers to exhalation. \u201cThe downward\naction of apana should be directed upwards by contraction of the perineum.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cMoola bandha brings\nabout the union of prana and apana, and nada and bindu. This will bestow\nperfection in yoga. Of this there is no doubt.\u201d Here, prana refers to the\nspecific functions of the body which supply energy into the body to maintain\nthe upkeep. This prana is contained in food, air that is breathed, as well as\nsubtle prana in the environment. In the context of pranayama, prana refers to\ninhalation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Balance of prana and\napana implies that there is equilibrium between the incoming and outgoing\nenergies of the body. In the case of pranayama, balance of inhalation and\nexhalation signifies the retention of breath (kumbhaka).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Place of contraction:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The area to be\ncontracted is the physical trigger point of the mooladhara chakra. This has a\nslightly different location in men and women. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For males: in the\nperineum, between the anus and the sexual organ.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For females: at the\ncervix, where the vagina and the uterus meet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Moola bandha is often\ndone incorrectly by contraction of the anus. Try to find the exact location\nthat we have described and apply the contraction at that point during moola\nbandha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">2. Uddiyana bandha</b>:&nbsp; &nbsp; abdominal contraction, compress the digestive organs, adrenal glands, kidneys,\nand most important the solar plexus. Uddiyana bandha tones the sympathetic\nnervous system, encouraging it to work more efficiently. It also enables us to\ngain control over the sympathetic nervous system so that it does not function\nin inappropriate situations, thus avoiding the effects of stress and anxiety.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sanskrit word\nuddiyana means \u2018to raise up\u2019 or to fly upwards. This practice is so called\nbecause the physical lock applied to the body causes the diaphragm to rise rise\ntowards the chest. Another reason for the name is that it helps direct prana\ninto the sushumna nadi so that it flows upwards to sahasrara.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sushumna nadi is\nthe subtle pranic pathway within the spine which passes through the main\npsychic centers (chakras). The awakening of these centers implies a progressive\nexpansion of awareness, until the cosmic awareness (sahasrara) is attained.\nThis is why uddyana bandha is useful for helping to expand awareness. For this\npurpose, it is systematically combined with specific pranayama practices.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Uddiyana bandha is\nmentioned in a large number of scriptures.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These include the Hatha Yoga\nPradipika,the Gherand Samhita and the Baraha, Yoga Sikha, Yoga Kundalini,\nDhyana Bindu, Yoga Tattva and Chudamani Upanishads.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Hatha Yoga Pradipika gives the most detail: \u201c That lock\nwhich causes the prana to fly up the shushumna is called uddiyana by all\nyogis.\u201d(3:55)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe practice to be\ndescribed causes the bird (of prana) to fly upwards after taking a period of\nrest.\u201d (3:56) In other words, the latent prana is directed into the shushumna. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cDrawing the abdomen\nbackwards and upwards in the navel region is called uddiyana. It is the lion\nwhich challenges the elephant of death.\u201d (3:57)&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That is, the practice helps to\ntrancscend normal states of awareness so that one gains insight into the nature\nof existence and mortality and the purpose of life.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Uddiyana bandha &nbsp;has many subtle influences on the pranic body.\nThe navel is the area of the manipura chakra, which is the center of prana in\nthe body. Physical stimulation of this area has repercussions on the more\nsubtle flows of prana and its distribution throughout the body.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Uddiyana also\nredirects prana into the shushumna nadi. This helps to expand awareness and\ninduces meditation.</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">3. Jalandhara bandha</b>:\nthroat compression, stretches the neck, pulling the spinal cord and thus the\nbrain. This bandha has subtle effects on the pituitary and pineal glands while\nthe forward flexion of the chin affects the thyroid, parathyroid and thymus\ngland. At the same time stimulates the parasympathetic spinal area in the\nmedulla oblongata regulating heart rate, respiration and blood pressure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jalandhara is the\npractice or physical lock that controls the net or network of nadis in the\nneck. These nadis can be either blood vessels, nerves or pranic passages. The\n\u2018fluid\u2019 or stream can cover all these different levels of subtlety, for\njalandhara bandha will influence all of them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are sixteen\nspecific centers in the body called adharas. This word means \u2018base\u2019 or\n\u2018substratum\u2019. They refer to chakras which are located in the following sixteen\nregions of the body: toes, ankles, knees, thighs, perineum, coccyx, navel,\nheart, neck, tonsils, tongue, nose, eyebrow center, eyes, back of the head and\ncrown of the head.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In various practices one\u2019s awareness is rotated through\nthese centers. Prana flows through these regions within the pranic body.\nTherefore, jalandhara bandha can also be defined as the practice that locks the\npranic network in the neck. This prevents flow of prana between the centers and\ndirects prana into sushumna nadi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The breath is to be\nretained during jalandhara bandha. The retention can either be antar kumbhaka\n(inner retention) or bahir kumbhaka (outer retention) or both, depending on the\npractice and integration with other techniques. That is, one can either breathe\nin deeply, fully inflating the lungs and then do jaladhara bandha, or one can\nexhale deeply then do jalandhara bandha. Both methods have their use in\nassociation with other practices.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jalandhara bandha\ncompress the carotid sinuses. These are bodies located on the carotid arteries\nin the neck, which are the main arteries supplying blood to the brain. These\ncarotid bodies are called baroreceptors and help to regulate and match the\nheart rate and blood pressure with the respiratory system. These receptors feed\nmessages to the brain through the sinus nerves, which in turn takes the\nnecessary actions to balance the circulatory and respiratory system.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\ncarotid bodies become compressed if the blood pressure rises. This sends a\nmessage to the brain which takes steps to prevent this high blood pressure. In\njalandhara bandha, these receptors are artificially compressed. This tends to\nprevent a sudden rise in blood pressure which would be expected when the breath\nis held for some time. This increases the duration of breath retention and so\nincreases the effectiveness of practices such as nadi shodana pranayama. These\ncarotid sinuses were well known in ancient times, as were also the sinus\nnerves.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Shiva Samhita it\nsays: \u201dStop the flow of the vijnana nadis (sinus nerves) with the second\nfingers (that is press the side of your neck with your fingers). This gives\nsiddhi (perfecion) in the form of happiness and bliss.\u201d (55,56) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You may become\nunconscious if you are not careful. This is caused by reducing or preventing\nthe blood flow to the brain. But the implications of the above verses are\nobvious; if you gently press these carotid sinuses then you will become very\nrelaxed and perhaps a little faint. This can be a help in various other yogic\npractices that lead to meditational experience.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many people have\nfainted by mere pressure of carotid sinuses s. &nbsp;&nbsp;Carotid sinuses can be pressed to prevent or\ncounteract tachycardia (fast heartbeat beyond the normal limit) This is often\nused in medical circles. A gentle massage of the carotid sinuses slows down the\nheart rate and brings about a faster normalization<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jalandhara bandha\ninfluences the individual at all levels: physical, psychic and mental. It controls\nthe flow of prana in the body. This induces mental relaxation and can help to\ninduce meditation. The pressuraization of the carotid sinuses also helps to\nbring mental balance by slowing down the heart. Further- more, this encourages\nintroversion \u2013 one tends to become oblivious to the outside world. The whole\nnervous system and brain become sedated. One tends to become more one-pointed.\nAll this is a great help in meditational practices.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jalandhara bandha\nallows one to hold the breath for longer periods of time. Normally decrease of\noxygen and increase of carbon dioxide in the system lead to an increase of the\nheart rate and harder breathing to compensate. This is initiated through the\ncarotid sinuses. The artificial pressure of these sinuses during jalandhara\nbandha prevents this tendency. Therefore, one is able to hold the breath for\nmuch longer periods. This also helps induce one-pointedness of mind for\nmeditational practices.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This bandha closes the\nwindpipe and compresses various organs in the throat. Notably it massages the\nthyroid gland which is located in the cavity of the throat. The whole body\ndepends on this gland for perfect development and maintenance. Jalandhara\nbandha massages this gland and helps to render it efficient.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are numerous\nscriptural references to jalandhara bandha. The following are a selected few\nfrom the Hatha Yoga Pradipika.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cContract the throat\nand firmly press the chin against the chest. This is called jalandhara bandha\nand helps to prevent old age and death.\u201d (3:70)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cIt blocks all the\nnadis in the neck, checks the fall of amrit (divine fluid) which drops from the\nheavens. It should be done to cure throat ailments.\u201d (3:71)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe contraction of the\nthroat during jalandhara bandha prevents the amrit falling into the digestive\nfire. In this way prana is conserved (that is, the prana is controlled and\ndirected only into the sushumna; flow of prana in the other nadis ceases).\u201d\n(3:72)</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThis contraction of\nthe throat also immobilizes the flow of prana in the ida and pingala nadis\n(associated with the flow of breath in the left and right nostrils). Again this\nblocks the flow of prana to the sixteen adharas and directs it into the\nsushumna.\u201d (3:73)<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The network of vessels\nthrough which the blood circulates is not just an arrangement of hollow tubes.\nIt is a generator and distributor of prana as well. These vessels become\ncharged and polarized as the bloodstream circulates throughout the body. It is\nas though the whole arterial and venous circulatory trees become magnetized.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The flow of blood through the vessels generates a bio-magnetic force just as a\nforceful flow of water is used to generate hydro electricity. This is how prana\nshakti is able to permeate and enliven even the most distant cells and tissues\nof the body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Under normal conditions\na certain quantum of prana is circulating, and this is responsible for our\npresent level of health. However, the importance of pranayama is to enable us\nto consciously generate a higher voltage of prana and this greater quantum of\nprana can then be directed into the higher centres of the brain, via the\ncerebral blood vessels and the cerebrospinal fluid circulating and irrigating\nthe brain's sleeping centres.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this way, pranayama brings a higher reality,\nexperience and dimension to its practitioner. It boosts the level of\nconsciousness by activating and awakening the dormant centres and capacities of\nthe left and right hemispheres of the evolving brain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6817765930421236243\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_26M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/02/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_3.html?showComment=1517737338479#c6817765930421236243\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 4, 2018 at 3:12 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_26MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/videos/city/delhi/monkeys-being-drugged-with-sedatives-to-catch-them-allege-gurugram-animal-activists/videoshow/62774393.cms</span><br />\n<br />\nWHAT IS THE USE OF MONKEY WHEN ALIVE OR DEAD ?<br />\n<br />\nAT LEAST A PIG IS USEFUL WHEN DEAD-- PEOPLE EAT IT<br />\n<br />\nIT WAS JEW ROTHSCHILD WHO CONVERTED MONKEY HANUMAN INTO A GOD.<br />\n<br />\nBEFORE THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA THERE WAS NOT A SINGLE HANUMAN TEMPLE<br />\n<br />\nIN 1947, WE HAD 20 TIMES MORE HANUMAN TEMPLE THAN RAM TEMPLES<br />\n<br />\nJEW ROTHSCHILD CONVERTED THE MONKEY OF RAMAYANA INTO GOD<br />\n<br />\nDEVADASI WHORES WHERE MARRIED OFF TO MONKEY HANUMAN...<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/02/devadasi-system-immoral-lie-of-temple.html</span><br />\n<br />\nGITA PRESS IN GORAKHPUR PRINTED LAKHS OF SMALL \"HANUMAN CHALISA \" BOOKLETS IN AWADHI<br />\n<br />\nMATSYENDRANATH IS THE FOUNDER OF FAKE NATH MUTT<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matsyendranath</span><br />\nBOTH TANTRA AND SWARA YOGA ARE IN THE FORM OF SHIVA TEACHING IS WIFE PARVATI .. REMEMBER BOTH ARE COSMIC ALLEGORIES .. BOT TANTRA AND SWARA YOGA WERE NOT PENNED DOWN IN 5000 BC--AS THEY HAD POTENT POWERS TO \"MAKE OR BREAK\"<br />\n<br />\nCHECK OUT HOW PEEPING TOM --FAKE-- MATSYENDRANATH EAVES DROPPED<br />\n<br />\nQUOTE: Legends tell that Matsyendra was born under an inauspicious star. This warranted his parents to throw the baby into the ocean. It is here that the baby was swallowed by a fish where he lived for many years. The fish swam to the bottom of the ocean where Shiva was imparting the secrets of yoga to his consort, Parvati. Upon overhearing the secrets of yoga, Matsyendra began to practice yoga sadhana inside the fish's belly. After twelve years he finally emerged as an enlightened Siddha .UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\nTEE HEEEE<br />\n<br />\nSCRATCH---WHERE IS MY BANANA ?<br />\n<br />\nBY THE WAY -- KERALA EXPORTED MONKEYS TRAINED IN PLUCKING FRUITS --TO ANCIENT EGYPT<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/05/land-of-punt-ophir-and-sheba-is-north.html</span><br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prana nourishes your\nbrain as it supervises the workings of your nervous system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prana is not only the\nlife force, it is also a very powerful healing force in the body that can even\neradicate the most difficult physical problems. Rememeber , the prana within us\nis a part of the universal prana.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Throughout your body\nthere is a pranic field which is known as pranamaya kosha. You must know how to\ntune this pranamaya kosha with the universal prana.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your pranamaya kosha can be\nawakened by practising pranayama correctly, by fasting or eating properly, and\nby perfecting meditation on the mid-eyebrow centre. Then, when you are able to\nsee that great enveloping light, you become the medium of the universal prana.\nThereafter, you can distribute this prana to those who are in short supply.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: white;\">Fasting is done by\nHindus 3 days </span><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">after </span><span style=\"background-color: white;\">full moon ( purnima ) or new moon ( amavasya )..&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></span></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: white;\">If&nbsp; a Hindu fasts for 3 days continiously , he does it starting\nfrom from full/ new moon for 3 days ..</span></b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">FASTING IN SANATANA\nDHARMA HAS TO DO WITH THE PULL OF THE MOON ON WATER .. AND WE HUMANS ARE FULL OF\nWATER...... </span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">THREE DAYS AFTER FULL/\nNEW MOON PRODUCES &nbsp;HIGH WATER SPRINGS (\nTIDES ) WHERE WATERS IN HARBORS ARE HIGHEST .....<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">THE WHITE INVADER FOOLED HINDUS INTO FASTING ON WRONG DATES --SPOILING HIS HEALTH&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>Autophagy </b>of the body\nmeans it cleanses itself of damaged, dead and unrepaired cells.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">It\u2019s a natural\nprocess where good cells create membranes that hunt out scraps of dead,\ndiseased, infectious cells and gobble them up. .</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">When the process of autophagy\noccurs in the body there is actually a feeling of reinvigoration as fresh\nenergy flows in...&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">The &nbsp;process of\nautophagy is unique to fasting \u2013 something not found in simple caloric\nrestriction or dieting..Fasting is ineffective if you do NOT ground your body.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>Below:&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;AUTOPHAGY by 3 day fasting -- is mentioned in Charaka Samhita 4200 BC.. The time window is FROM full/ new moon for 3 days .&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>However if you can fast only for one day then do it \"three days after full/new moon \"</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/iqsnO7om-9A/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/iqsnO7om-9A?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>By stimulating autophagy, we are clearing out\nall our old, junky proteins and cellular parts.&nbsp; &nbsp;At the same time, fasting also\nstimulates growth hormone, which tells our body to start producing some new\nsnazzy parts for the body. We are really giving our bodies the complete\nrenovation..<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>The &nbsp;cells\ncan become senescent (ceasing to divide and grow) and lay around secreting\ninflammatory compounds that can damage nearby cells, or die. If these\ndysfunctional cells are not effectively cleared up from the body, this can lead\nto disease. <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>That\u2019s where autophagy comes into play. It\nmarks these cells and removes them<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>THE SHALLOW MINDED WHITE MAN CALLED HINDUS\nSUPERSTITIOUS SAVAGES FOR FASTING <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Fasting has benefits in type 2 diabetes,\nobesity and metabolic syndrome<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>During fasting, when we don\u2019t eat, our\ninsulin levels go down and glucagon goes up. This enables the body to identify\ndamaged cells and break them down preferentially.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Yoshinori Ohsumi won the Nobel Prize in\nPhysiology or Medicine ( 2016 ) for his discovery ( sic ) about autophagy\u2014though\nHindus have been doing it for milliniums. Autophagy and Apoptosis&nbsp; was written 6200 years ago in Charaka Samhita<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">Apoptosis is PROGRAMMED cell death. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Cells, after a certain number of division,\nare programmed to die. &nbsp;&nbsp;While this may\nsound kind of macabre at first, realize that this process is essential in\nmaintaining good health..&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Cells become old and junky. It is better that they be\nprogrammed to die when their useful life is done. It sounds really cruel, but\nthat\u2019s life<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">APOPTOSIS IS LIKE JUNKING YOUR OLD CAR AND\nGETTING A NEW ONE \u2014 &nbsp;WHILE AUTOPHAGY IS\nREPAIRING IT IN A PREDICTIVE MANNER &nbsp;AND\nKEEPING IT GOING </span><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Instead of killing off the entire cell\n(apoptosis), you only want to replace some cell parts. That is the process of\nautophagy, where sub-cellular organelles are destroyed and new ones are rebuilt\nto replace it.&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Old cell membranes, organelles and other cellular debris can be\nremoved. T<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Autophagy is essentially a form a cellular\ncleaning, and it is important because accumulation of junky cells is THE\nhallmark of ageing.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Hindus who fasted for 3 days\u2014never got cancer\nor dementia</span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Autophagy has the ability to prevent the\ndevelopment of neurodegenerative diseases, like Alzheimer\u2019s disease, by\nclearing away abnormal or harmful protein aggregates such as amyloid beta.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Autophagy is often followed by a massive\nboost in stem cells that can replenish or replace beta cells destroyed by\nautoimmune processes with healthy cells<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>If insulin goes up, glucagon goes down. If\ninsulin goes down, glucagon goes up. As we eat insulin goes up and glucagon\ngoes down. When we don\u2019t eat (fast) insulin goes down and glucagon goes up.&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>This increase in glucagon stimulates the process of autophagy. In fact, fasting\n(raises glucagon) provides the greatest known boost to autophagy.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>This is in essence a form of cellular\ncleansing. The body identifies old and substandard cellular equipment and marks\nit for destruction. It is the accumulation of all this junk that may be\nresponsible for many of the effects of aging.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Fasting is actually far more beneficial than\njust stimulating autophagy. It does two good things. By stimulating autophagy,\nwe are clearing out all our old, junky proteins and cellular parts.&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>At the same\ntime, fasting also stimulates growth hormone, which tells our body to start\nproducing some new snazzy parts for the body. We are really giving our bodies\nthe complete renovation.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>The consequences of accumulating old junky\nproteins all over the place can be seen in two main conditions \u2013 Alzheimer\u2019s\nDisease (AD) and cancer.&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Alzheimer\u2019s Disease involves the accumulation of\nabnormal protein \u2013 either amyloid beta or Tau protein which gums up the brain\nsystem. It would make sense that a process like autophagy that has the ability\nto clear out old protein could prevent the development of AD.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>What turns off autophagy? &nbsp;&nbsp;Eating !&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Glucose, insulin (or decreased\nglucagon) and proteins all turn off this self-cleaning process. And it doesn\u2019t\ntake much. Even a small amount of amino acid (leucine) could stop autophagy\ncold. So this process of autophagy is unique to fasting \u2013 something not found\nin simple caloric restriction or dieting.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Eating prevents autophagy.&nbsp; &nbsp;Protein switches\non an enzyme called mTOR, which is a powerful inhibitor of autophagy, while\ncarbohydrates cause a rise in insulin and a corresponding fall in glucagon.\nFat, on the other hand, has less of an impact on autophagy, and some people\nfind it helpful to consume small amounts of coconut oil or butter during a\nfast.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Cancer patients fasting up to 72 hours before\nchemo can lower damage to immune cells and reduced biomarkers of cancer. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We ask\nthe Indian health minister to read this line a hundred times.&nbsp;
