We can take in much more than our normal\nquota of oxygen and prana.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a normal breath, we\ninhale 500 CC &nbsp;of air, and then breathe\nout the same.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">After an exhalation,\nthe lungs are almost empty, but still there is residual air in the lungs.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">After we breathe out\nour normal five hundred cubic centimeters, IF WE PULL IN THE ABDOMEN SLIGHTLY ,\nWE CAN EXHALE SOME MORE AIR , which has been measured as 1600 CC</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After this type of full\nexhalation, if we begin to inhale, we first breathe in the air that we squeezed\nout \u20131600 CC<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When we do deep diaphragmatic\nbreathing , we supercharge the blood with extra oxygen.. along with the air we\ntake in more prana. Every cell of the body vibrates with new life. At that\npoint no virus can even think of coming near. As soon as it comes near, we burn\nit out. Proper breathing can heal. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pickle Johns who try to\nimpress Chutney Marys &nbsp;by wearing tight T\nshirts and sucking in their stomachs ( for surfboard flat 6 pack stomach ) fall\nsick and have shit for brains.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An example of an\nultradian rhythm in the body is the nasal cycle as defined by an alternation of\nvasoconstriction in one nostril and vasodilation in the other &nbsp;.Nasal tissue is highly innervated by the\nsympathetic nervous system..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nasal shifting is&nbsp;\ncoupled to lung inflation. Forced inhalation through<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">one nostril is paired\nwith increased ipsilateral lung inflation referred to as the pulmonary reflex\nmechanism.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a sympathetic coupling mechanism where vasoconstriction in\none nostril is associated with vasodilation of the ipsilateral ( same side ) lung\n.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The nasal cycle is\nassociated with REM (rapid eye movement) and NREM (non-rapid eye movement) stages\nduring sleep where the right nostril dominates with REM and the left with NREM\nstages. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Insomnia is associated\nwith unilateral nasal obstruction. There are coordinated rhythms between\nhemispheric dominance, sleep stages, autonomic, digestive, and endocrine systems.\n&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hemispheric cerebral\nmetabolic rates are consistent with these patterns. This provides a beneficial expansion force to\nthe palate, helps decrease excessive muscle tension in the body, and facilitate\nnasal breathing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nasal airflow is\ngreater in one nostril than in the other because of transient asymmetric nasal\npassage obstruction by erectile tissue. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, the extent of\nobstruction alternates across nostrils with periodicity referred to as the\nnasal cycle. The nasal cycle is related to autonomic arousal and is indicative\nof asymmetry in brain function. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The physical mechanism\nunderlying the nasal cycle is an asymmetry in blood flow leading to engorgement\nof erectile tissue in the anterior part of the nasal septum and inferior\nturbinate of one nostril over the other .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This asymmetrically enlarged tissue\nphysically blocks the passage of air in one nostril more than in the other.\nAlthough this physical mechanism has been identified, the physiological\nmechanisms that drive it are not equally well understood by modern doctors .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most of the Chutney Marys\nbehave like TURDs ( nag nag nag )&nbsp;\nbecause of electrolytic and hormonal imbalance. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Read all 4 parts of the\npost below- it should be in the Indian coaching manual. Most of our coaches (\nIndian and foreign ) are idiots of the first order.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/marathon-running-secrets-of.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/marathon-running-secrets-of.html</a></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A right nostril\nbreathing exercise, that primarily stimulates the left hemisphere, reduces\nsymptoms more quickly for hallucinations.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the left nostril\nis more open, the right hemisphere of the brain is&nbsp; more dominant; when the right nostril is more\nopen, the left hemisphere is more dominant.&nbsp;\nSwara Yogis made use of this&nbsp; fact\nfor their own well-being. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The subconscious mind\ndoes not think\u2014it is only a store house of our experience. It has no sense of\ntime. It cannot differentiate between positive and negative input. It cannot\ntell the difference between real and imagines experience.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The conscious mind can\nbe engaged 100% in talking or deep thinking while the subconscious keeps the\ncar on the road. The conscious and subconscious minds are connected through a\nfilter. So we cant read the contents of our subconscious mind<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WQBG2NgCMv8/WnT6d5oVCiI/AAAAAAABYXI/4XSUToXNmtwvnpjtkf7YCL038_EqdVaBwCLcBGAs/s1600/olp-subconscious.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"312\" data-original-width=\"472\" height=\"263\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-WQBG2NgCMv8/WnT6d5oVCiI/AAAAAAABYXI/4XSUToXNmtwvnpjtkf7YCL038_EqdVaBwCLcBGAs/s400/olp-subconscious.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Conscious&nbsp;</b> = induction+\ndeduction ( determines what is to be done ). LEFT BRAIN LOBE ( for right\nhanders ): Numbers, written language, reasoning, spoken language, scientific\nskills , RH control<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><br /></b>\n<b><br /></b>\n<b><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>Subconscious</b> = only\ndeduction ( no thinking , draws conclusions, does not care for right or wrong,\ngives the power to do the job ) RIGHT BRAIN LOBE ( for right handers ):\nInsight, 3D forms , art, imagination, music, left hand control</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-9-uu0FwZNic/WnT6MrvkBnI/AAAAAAABYXE/kk_FI576d5IqtUMXaICwlnHccFJcF8fCwCLcBGAs/s1600/the_humsean_mind_self-conscious_subconscious_450x253256.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"253\" data-original-width=\"450\" height=\"358\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-9-uu0FwZNic/WnT6MrvkBnI/AAAAAAABYXE/kk_FI576d5IqtUMXaICwlnHccFJcF8fCwCLcBGAs/s640/the_humsean_mind_self-conscious_subconscious_450x253256.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The conscious mind has\nlimited memory. The subconscious mind has unlimited memory.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Subconscious mind never\nsleeps even in a coma. the Subconscious has a tendency to accept what it\nimagines as real.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The central nervous\nsystem does not know the difference between visualization and the event.\nVisualizing you are having sex and doing the real thing has the same effect.\nYogis in solitude knew how to remain happy.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Persons who can do self\nhypnosis has discovered the secret of successful living. All hypnosis is self\nhypnosis.. Hypnosis is an altered state of consciousness, during which the\nconscious critical mind is relaxed and relatively inactive, and the doorway to\nthe subconscious, inner mind is opened with a person\u2019s permission.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A hypnotic\nstage is not mysterious. You actually enter and exit this state of mind many\ntimes during a ordinary day. &nbsp;Swara Yogis\nknew how to trigger this state. They could hypnotize themselves as well as\nothers. Yogi could sit in snow and melt it around them</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The picture in our mind\nhas an impact on every cell in our bodies. Thinking is not an action of the\nmind , but an action of our entire body. Tell your subconscious what you want\nrepeatedly and it will produce it. You can call this visualization or\nintention.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The subconscious has a perfect\nmemory. Every thing you have experienced using your 5 senses is part of the\npermanent memory of the subconscious mind, which never sleeps&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The subconscious\nmind acts on old beliefs stored over a lifetime. Many of those beliefs you may\nhave accepted without thinking. Or you may have absorbed them when you were too\nyoung to exercise choice..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Subconscious mind has a\nmemory of 100 trillion images, all our experiences, emotions and feelings are\nstored as an image or a sound in a digitised manner . Data that cannot be\nrecalled are retained in the subconscious.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A person may be unconscious of ever\nhaving been locked in a closet as a child, yet under hypnosis he may recall the\nexperience vividly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Negative suggestions\nwith growing children gets rooted in their subconscious mind and is reflected\nlater in their behavior. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During hypnosis \u2013our\nconscious mind goes into a trance and suggestions are given directly to the\nsubconscious mind, which cannot argue but accepts the suggestion at its face\nvalue.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We do self hypnosis\nunknowingly several times an a day while doing our day to day activities. This\nis how our body learns to relax otherwise we would die of stress at a very\nearly age.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Lbb8UdROoU4/WnT64j9t6JI/AAAAAAABYXQ/fo5S9huVKCAkRAHj0rDsxfxoK9VxZgJJwCLcBGAs/s1600/main-qjimg-1adc2282bfbf5e2da71661b17794a673-c.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"384\" data-original-width=\"512\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Lbb8UdROoU4/WnT64j9t6JI/AAAAAAABYXQ/fo5S9huVKCAkRAHj0rDsxfxoK9VxZgJJwCLcBGAs/s640/main-qjimg-1adc2282bfbf5e2da71661b17794a673-c.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MOST CHILDREN WHO HAVE\nBEEN DIAGNOSED AS ADHD AFFECTED \u2014DO CHEST BREATHING (HYPERVENTILATION)</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When we\nHYPERVENTILATE&nbsp; we take quick, shallow\nbreaths from the top of our chest. This kind of breathing sharply REDUCES&nbsp; the level of carbon dioxide in our blood.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This reduced level of carbon dioxide causes the arteries, including the carotid\nartery going to the brain, to constrict, thus REDUCING the flow of blood\nthroughout the body.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When this occurs, no matter how much oxygen we may breathe\ninto our lungs, our brain and body will experience a shortage of oxygen. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The LACK of oxygen\nswitches on the sympathetic nervous system\u2013 our \u201cfight or flight reflex\u201d\u2013which\nmakes us tense, anxious, and irritable.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nSuch breathing also reduces our ability to think clearly, and tends to\nput us at the mercy of obsessive thoughts and images. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyperventilation can\nactually magnify our psychological problems and conflicts, and that chronic\nhyperventilation is intimately bound up with our anxieties, apprehensions, and\nfears. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MANY HEALTHY PEOPLE\nHAVE BEEN FALSELY DECLARED AS PARANOID SCHIZOPHERENICS <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The key to slowing down our breathing is not\nto try to slow it down, but rather to learn how to breathe more fully, using\nour diaphragm, belly, rib cage, and lower back in the breathing process. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Such mindful breathing\nhelps us \u201center the mind-body conversation without judgments or opinions,\nreleasing peptide molecules from the hindbrain to regulate breathing while\nunifying all systems.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Patients who learned to slow down their\nbreathing through special deep breathing exercises ended up with higher levels\nof blood oxygen.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is most important to&nbsp;\nbreathe through the nose. This has to do with maintaining the correct\nbalance of oxygen and carbon dioxide in our blood. When we breathe through our\nmouth we usually inhale and exhale air quickly in large volumes. This often\nleads to a kind of hyperventilation (breathing excessively fast for the actual\nconditions in which we find ourselves). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IT IS CRITICAL TO\nRECOGNISE THAT IT IS THE AMOUNT OF CARBON DI OXIDE IN OUR BLOOD THAT GENERALLY\nREGULATES OUR BREATHING<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If we release carbon\ndioxide too quickly, the arteries and vessels carrying blood to our cells\nconstrict and the oxygen in our blood is unable to reach the cells in\nsufficient quantity. This includes the carotid arteries which carry blood (and\noxygen) to the brain.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The lack of sufficient oxygen going to the cells of the\nbrain can turn on our sympathetic nervous system, our \u201cfight or flight\u201d\nresponse, and make us tense, anxious, irritable, and depressed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Laughter, especially a\ngood belly laugh, is also a good source of cardiac exercise and promotes better\nbreathing. It strengthens the breathing muscles in a natural way, and makes\nthem more supple. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Breathing through the\nmouth tends to inflate only the upper lobes of the lungs, which are connected\nto sympathetic nerve fibers, the branch of the nervous system that activates\nthe flight-or-flight fear response. \u2026&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you switch to deep nose breathing,\nyou inflate the entire lung, including the lower lobes, which are connected to\nthe parasympathetic branch of the nervous system, the branch that calms the\nbody, slows the heart rate, relaxes, and soothes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through proper nose\nbreathing, you employ both branches of the nervous system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Never&nbsp; let yourself become \u201cbreathless\u201d during your\nworkout.&nbsp;&nbsp; When we become breathless, we\nundermine our breathing coordination, BURN sugar instead of fat for fuel, and\nbecome tight and tense (which can promote injury).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The simplest way to\nknow whether you are exercising too intensely and becoming breathless is to try\nto speak several sentences out loud while you\u2019re working out.&nbsp; If you can\u2019t do it without gasping for\nbreath, then your workout is no longer \u201caerobic\u201d\u2013it is, or is about to become,\n\u201canaerobic,\u201d which means that it is proceeding without oxygen and you are no\nlonger burning fat for fuel.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Breathing problems is\nthe main cause of&nbsp; bed wetting among\nchildren and some adults.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">80% of children who wet\ntheir beds&nbsp; have a narrow palate that\ncauses breathing problems. When the roof of the mouth is too narrow, the tongue\nis often pushed back and, during sleep, can partially block the airway.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This can be eaily\nfigured out.&nbsp; Using a brace to widen the\npalate with a can produce dramatic improvements. A study in the UK found that\nall of the children who used the brace stopped wetting the bed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Low blood oxygen, which\ninfluences the hormones , are involved in the production of urine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Out of 300 bedwetting\nchildren who had surgery to reduce airway obstruction, 25 percent stopped\nwetting their beds almost immediately<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Those people who had\nthe worst sleep apnea at the beginning of the study were the ones most likely\nto later develop high blood pressure. Sleep apnea is a condition in which a\nperson\u2019s breathing stops between several and dozens of time an hour, without the\nperson knowing it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People who see\nPOOCHAANDI ( sinister ghosts ) while they sleep have breathing problems which\nreduce oxygen in their blood.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/12/sleep-paralysis-and-sinister-presence.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/12/sleep-paralysis-and-sinister-presence.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reduced oxygen in the\nblood puts the sympathetic nervous system, the part of the nervous system that\nreacts to stress and prepares the body for action, into \u201chigh alert.\u201d-- mostly\nfalse alerts\u2014when people see this too often they declare the person a Paranoid\nSchizophenic<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People with sleep apnea\nare likely to snore loudly and to wake up feeling unrested.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Too much talking\nconditions the diaphragm to move in constricted, staccato ways, as we breathe\nthrough our mouth while struggling for breath in the middle of our words, which\nmeans that the diaphragm will not be able to function rhythmically and\nefficiently in helping to empty the lungs, massage our internal organs, and\npromote lymph flow.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you are in a profession that requires a lot of talking,\none thing you can try is slowing down your speech, make it more rhythmical and\nsteady, and, when you\u2019re not talking, breathe when possible through your nose.\nYou can and should also practice breathing more from your belly as you speak.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At a given moment, if\nyou're breathing through your nose, the lion\u2019s share of the air is going in and\nout of one nostril, with a much smaller amount passing through the other.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every\nfew hours, your autonomic nervous system, which takes care of your heart rate,\ndigestion and other things you don\u2019t consciously control, switches things up\nand your other nostril does all the heavy lifting for a little while.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The opening and closing of the two passages\nis done by swelling and deflating erectile tissue - the same stuff that\u2019s at work\nwhen your reproductive organs are aroused - up in your nose.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The alternating\ncongestion gives the mucous and cilia (the tiny hairs up in your nose) in each\nnostril a well-deserved break from the onslaught of air and prevents the\ninsides of your nostrils from drying out, cracking and bleeding.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lying on the right side\nof the body, which yogis have long suggested it a good way to sleep, slows down\nleft brain dominance and opens the left nostril and activates the right side of\nthe brain for inner work, creativity, relaxation, and sleep.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Turbinates consist of\nbony projections covered by erectile tissue, much like the tissues of the penis\nand clitoris. The turbinates in one fossa filled up with blood while the\nopposite turbinates decongested by shunting blood away. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The cilia of the\ncongested side suspend their motility until that side decongests. Thus the\ncycle ensures that one side of the nose is always moist, to facilitate\nhumidification, which is one of the three functions of the nose, the other two\nbeing filtration and warming of inspired air prior to its entering the lungs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With high airflow on\none side and low airflow on the other side, the olfactory center detects a\ngreater range of smells \u2013like I said before <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">The special branch of\nyoga that studies the upsurge (udaya) of flowing energy (svara) within these\nnadis is called svarodaya, or svara yoga.&nbsp;\nThis was passed down for millinuums by oral route and was NOT penned\ndown in 5000 BC</span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Through the practices\nof svara yoga, you can learn to be aware of the presence of these streams of\nenergy, to discern how they shift and flow, and to observe their relationship\nwith inner and outer life.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">The tantric text, the Shiva Svarodaya, ( as told by\nShiva to Parvati )&nbsp; states that\nultimately such knowledge \u201cis like a lamp capable of illuminating the vessel of\none\u2019s own Self.\u201d</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/AiBwrwNeEZo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/AiBwrwNeEZo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, the nadi ending\nin the right nostril is called pingala. The nadi ending in the left nostril is\ncalled ida. The central nadi, sushumna, ends at the point between the nostrils\nwhere the nasal septum joins the upper lip. The relative activity of these nadis\nis reflected in the flow of breath within the nostrils.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus, when pingala is\nactive, the breath flows more prominently through the right nostril, and when\nida is active, the breath flows more freely through the left.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the central\nnadi (sushumna) is awakened, the two nostrils flow equally. Thus, the easiest\nway to identify the subtle activity of energy flowing in the nadis is to\nobserve the relative dominance of the breath in the nostrils.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Swara\nyoga, nostril dominance (or more precisely, svara dominance) tells a great deal\nabout our state of being. The energy flowing through the right nostril is\ndescribed as masculine energy and is characterized by an expansive mood.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is\nsymbolized by the sun, expressed in physical activity, manifested in logical\nthinking and left brain activity, reflected in good digestion, and generates\ninternal heat. When the right nostril is dominant, the mind favors the active\nsenses (hands, feet, organs of procreation, elimination, and speech). This is\nconducive for undertaking actions that require strength and mental\ndetermination.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Energy flowing through\nthe left nostril is described as feminine energy and is characterized by a more\nintrospective mood. It is symbolized by the moon, expressed in self-reflection,\nmanifested in intuitive or artistic forms of thought and right brain activity,\nreceptive by nature, and generates coolness.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the left nostril is dominant,\nthe mind favors the cognitive senses (taste, touch, sight, smell, and hearing).\nThis is conducive for undertaking actions that are restful, require\nreceptivity, and are inwardly oriented.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Finally, when the\nnostrils flow equally, the energy is associated with psychological balance and\na state of quiet self-observation. This state is androgynous by disposition,\nsymbolized by fire, expressed in mental quiescence, manifested in concentration\nand balanced brain hemisphere activity, and wise by nature.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is a highly\ndesirable state for meditation. But since it is conducive to states of mind\nthat are detached and lack worldly motivation, this is not a beneficial state\nfor everyday activity. Fortunately, except during purposeful meditative states,\nequal levels of nostril activity occur only briefly during the course of the\nday.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Milliniums&nbsp; ago, in the course of deep introspection,\nyogis found that for a person whose biorhythms are regular, nostril dominance\nwill shift periodically throughout the day; each nostril is active for about 90\nminutes&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This periodic shift was first\nobserved by the scientific community in the late 19th century and is called the\n\u201cnasal cycle.\u201d ( in reality stolen from 400 century old Sruti verses and\npatented )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The yogis paid\nattention to nostril shift-- by becoming aware of the rhythms of these internal\nenergies, they &nbsp;developed sensitivity to\nthem. &nbsp;&nbsp;They learnt how to flow along\nrather than struggle to natural rhythms.&nbsp;\nThey learnt to forcefully shift the dominant nostril by various\ntechniques including hyperventilation <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The yogis &nbsp;discovered by self experimentation that some\nactivities awaken the energies of a particular nostril.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some of these dominant nostril\nshiftings &nbsp;involve concentration\nalone\u2014for example, slowly \u201cpulling in\u201d each inhalation and \u201cpushing out\u201d each\nexhalation while focusing on the nostril he wants to open.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other yogic\ntechniques for changing nostril dominance involve activating a reflexive\nresponse which opens one nasal passage and closes the other: Lying on one side,\nfor instance, or putting pressure under the armpit with fist or a wooden &nbsp;arm crutch<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A simple technique for\nmeasuring your nasal dominance at home involves exhaling onto a mirror. Hold\nthe straight edge of a pocket mirror against your septum and gently exhale.\nWhen you examine the mirror, you will notice two puffs of condensation, one\nfrom each nostril.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mirror surface must be cooler than your breath for\ncondensation to form. The puff that takes the longest to evaporate came from\nthe dominant nostril.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga is a process of\nself-exploration. As you begin your experiments, keep in mind that we live in a\ncomplex world, one that is vastly different from that of the ancient yogis. The\nkey to self-exploration is to honestly and systematically explore, not to\nduplicate &nbsp;their findings.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">The Shiva Svarodaya\nassures us, \u201cthere is no secret more secret, no wealth more valuable, than swara\nyoga.\u201d</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prana is not only the\nbasic life-force, it is the original creative power of the cosmos.&nbsp; &nbsp;It is\nthe master form of all energy working at every level of our being. &nbsp;Indeed the entire universe is a manifestation\nof prana. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even kundalini shakti, the\nserpent power or inner energy which transforms our consciousness, develops from\nawakened prana.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pranamaya kosha is\nthe \u201cvital sheath\u201d .. The pranamaya kosha, which is connected to the five motor\norgans (excretory, urino-genital, feet, hands, and vocal organ), contains our\nurges for survival, reproduction, movement, and self-expression. It provides us\nwith enthusiasm and motivation for all we do.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most of us are\ndominated by the vital body and its deep-seated urges, which are necessary in\norder for us to remain alive. The vital body is the home of the subconscious\nego, which harbors our various fears, desires, and attachments.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most of us\nspend our life seeking enjoyment through this kosha in the form of sensory\npleasure and acquiring material objects.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People with a strong\nvital body are able to impress their personality on the world and often become\nprominent in life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Without a strong\nspiritualized pranamaya kosha, we lack the energy to do our practices in an\nintense and sustained manner.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pranamaya kosha is\ncomposed of the five pranas, also called vayus or \u201cforces of the air.\u201d These\nfive pranas are categorized according to movement and direction. This is an\nimportant topic in Ayurvedic medicine as well as in yogic practices.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prana vayu literally\nmeans \u201cforward-moving air,\u201d because it moves inward and governs all kinds of\nreception into the body, from eating, drinking, and inhaling, to the reception\nof sensory impressions and mental experiences. It is propulsive in nature,\nsetting things in motion and guiding them, and it provides the basic energy\nthat drives us in life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Apana vayu, \u201cthe air\nthat moves away,\u201d moves downward and outward, governing all forms of\nelimination and reproduction (which also has a downward movement).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It governs\nthe elimination of stool and urine, the expelling of semen, menstrual fluid,\nand the fetus, and the elimination of carbon dioxide through the breath. On a\ndeeper level, it rules the elimination of negative sensory, emotional, and\nmental experiences. It is the basis of our immune function. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Udana vayu, \u201cthe\nupward-moving air,\u201d moves up and brings about qualitative or transformative\nmovements of the life-energy. It governs the growth of the body and the ability\nto stand, as well as speech, effort, enthusiasm, and will. It is our main\npositive energy, helping us to develop our different sheaths and to evolve in\nconsciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samana vayu, \u201cbalancing\nair,\u201d moves from the periphery to the center, through a churning and discerning\naction. It aids digestion on all levels, working in the gastrointestinal tract\nto digest food, in the lungs to digest air or absorb oxygen, and in the mind to\ndigest experience\u2014sensory, emotional, and mental.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vyana vayu,\n\u201coutward-moving air,\u201d moves from the center to the periphery, governing\ncirculation on all levels. It moves food, water, and oxygen throughout the\nbody, and keeps our emotions and thoughts circulating in the mind, imparting\nmomentum and providing strength. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prana vayu governs the\nmovement of energy from the head down to the navel, which is the pranic center\nof the physical body. Apana vayu governs the movement of energy from the navel\ndown to the root chakra at the base of the spine.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samana vayu governs the\nmovement of energy from the entire body back to the navel. Vyana vayu governs\nthe movement of energy out from the navel throughout the entire body. Udana\nvayu governs the movement of energy from the navel up to the head.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In brief, prana vayu\ngoverns the intake of substances, samana governs their digestion, and vyana\ngoverns the circulation of nutrients. Udana governs the release of positive\nenergy, and apana governs the elimination of waste materials. This is much like\nthe working of an efficient machine.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prana brings in the fuel, samana converts\nthis fuel to energy, and vyana circulates the energy to various worksites.\nApana disposes of the waste products produced by the conversion process. Udana\nmanages the energy thus created, enabling the machine to function effectively.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The key to health is to\nkeep our pranas working in harmony. When one prana becomes imbalanced, the\nothers tend to lose their equilibrium as well, because they are all linked.\nGenerally prana and udana balance apana, as the forces of energization balance\nthose of elimination. Similarly vyana and samana coordinate with each other in\nterms of expansion and contraction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Breathing is the main\nform of pranic activity in the body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gross prana is taken in\nas food through the digestive process, The heart is the main energy center for\nthe pranamaya kosha. The head is the main energy center for manomaya kosha, or\nthe mental sheath, which is energized by sensory perception, dominated by the\neyes and ears.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Breathing is the main\nform of pranic activity in the body. Prana vayu governs inhalation; samana\ngoverns absorption of oxygen, which occurs mainly during retention of the\nbreath; and vyana governs its circulation. Apana rules exhalation, particularly\nwith regard to the release of carbon dioxide. Udana controls exhalation by\nreleasing positive energy through the breath, for example in speech or song.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Apana rules the elimination of toxic ideas and\nnegative emotions. Udana provides positive mental energy, strength, and\nenthusiasm.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On a psychological\nlevel, prana governs our receptivity to positive sources of nourishment,\nfeeling, and knowledge through the mind and senses. When deranged it causes\nunhealthy desires and insatiable cravings, and we become misguided,\nmisdirected, and generally out of balance. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Apana governs our\nability to eliminate negative thoughts and emotions. When deranged it causes\ndepression, and we get clogged up with undigested experience that weighs us\ndown in life, making us fearful, suppressed, and weak. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samana gives us\nnourishment, contentment, and a balanced mind. When deranged it brings about\nattachment and greed. We cling to things and become contracted, stagnant, and\npossessive in our behavior.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vyana gives free\nmovement and independence of mind. When deranged it can cause isolation,\nhatred, and alienation. We become unable to unite with others or to remain\nconnected with what we are doing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Udana gives us joy and\nenthusiasm and helps awaken our higher spiritual and creative potentials. When\nderanged it can cause pride and arrogance, and we become ungrounded, trying to\ngo too high and losing touch with our roots.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Samana regulates our inner fire, which must\nburn evenly. Without the peace and balance samana creates, we cannot return to\nthe core of our being or concentrate our mind. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vyana governs the\nmovement of prana through the nadis, keeping them open, clear, clean, and even\nin their functioning. Apana protects us from negative astral influences and\nillusory experiences. Prana vayu gives us the proper aspiration necessary for\nspiritual development. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Udana governs our\ngrowth in consciousness and carries the mind into the states of dreaming and\ndeep sleep, and into the after-death realms. Udana also governs movement up the\nsushumna. Because the mind moves with udana vayu, it is generally the most\nimportant prana for spiritual growth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As we practice yoga,\nthe subtle aspects of these pranas begin to awaken<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Proper nutrition\nincreases prana on a physical level. Proper elimination also helps .&nbsp;&nbsp; Apana is the most important prana for\nphysical health.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mudra is about free\nelectrons at the finger tips having concentrated nerve root endings , getting\nredirected back INTERNALLY to the brain along chosen neural circuits. This is\nvery differnt from external acupressure aue acupunture.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Five forces are\ncontrolled by Mudra.&nbsp; They are&nbsp; Prana, Apana, Samana, Vyana, and Udana, and\nthey are part of the&nbsp; Kundalini's energy.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through Mudras you&nbsp; gather these five forces together, bringing\nthem to their home, the Mother Kundalini, which is sleeping at the Muladhara\nChakra,&nbsp; as Static energy of the Mother\nof the Universe. Your Kundalini is sleeping. It has to be awakened , or you\nhave NOT experienced ecstasy and bliss on this planet.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the Apana rises\nupward to the 'Fire Chakra,' the flame of divine fire grows strong and bright,\nbeing fanned by Apana. When the Apana fire mixes with the Prana, which is\nnaturally hot, the spiritual heat of the body becomes bright and powerful.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the Kundalini\nfeels this extra heat, she will awaken from sleep; then she goes into the\nSushumna.&nbsp; The Kundalini is coiled like a\nserpent, and by Mudra the Kundalini will certainly move and open the mouth of\nthe Sushumna.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Without moving the\nKundalini, there are no other means that will clear away the impurities of the\n72000 Nadis.&nbsp; The Great Goddess\nKundalini, the Energy of the Self, sleeps in the Muladhara. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Parvati\u2019s son Ganesha\nopens the Muladhara Bandhana ( knot/ gate ) for his mother to move up and unite\nwith his father Shiva (</span><b> <span style=\"color: red;\">sorry Zakir Naik-you know SHIT </span></b><span style=\"color: blue;\">).</span></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
